Reviews.Title: “quaint, beachfront, nice garden area”
Reviews.Author: irishgal161
Reviews.Content: For the price this was a nice location. The room was adequate but nothing fancy. I would stay here again for the location. Welcome drink was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't care about the room. We love it!”
Reviews.Author: stricassoc
Reviews.Content: This was about the 5th time we have stayed at the Fusion. For the location and price, it can't be beat. You will not stay here if the room is a priority. They are very small, but we knew that. There is not any place to put your clothing, so don't expect to unpack, except to hang up a few things. But we still love this place. It is located right on the beach, or what's left of the beach. They have had some erosion. The beach was crowded on the weekend, but not so during the week. The food is good, and the service is quite nice. Often there is live music. As for the room, ours was updated from prior visits. It was obvious some changes had occurred. A new roof. A new air conditioner. A hair drier. A new flat screen TV with lots of channels for everyone who goes to Playa Del Carmen to watch TV. One thing that was not as good as in the past was the water pressure. Very, very low. And at one point, no pressure at all. But corrected within minutes after our reporting it to the front desk. Then we had our trickle again. But we certainly got HOT water after several minutes. And the room was quiet. You are also located just one block from 5th avenue, where most of the action occurs regarding restaurants and shopping. There is a lot of energy on 5th Ave. It reminds me of going to Disney World and spending time in one of their villages or countries. And you are only about 2 blocks from the bus station, so taking the bus from the airport is also inexpensive and convenient. (Tip: for a good meal for peanuts go to the restaurant on the beach on 2'nd street. The Fusion is on the beach at 6th street. That's 2 blocks). This is probably the only place you can find like this in Playa. What would have been the competition have been bought up and are now new condo's. We've never known anyone who stayed there that didn't like it. And this year it was like old home week. We saw quite a few people staying there who had stayed there when we had in past trips. We rated it excellent for what it was. We really like staying here, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We really wanted to like it...”
Reviews.Author: Ryannroxx
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay on the beach for a few days before going to our usual hotel and Fusion fit the bill. We have ate at their outside restaurant and found the atmosphere amazing. We were greeted by the nicest woman and told our room would be ready in 10 minutes, We also were given a coupon for a free cocktail for myself and husband and a free beverage for my daughter at their restaurant while we waited. When we arrived at the room there was a nice flat screen on the wall. The beds were very comfortable but upon inspection we were unhappy with the condition of things and asked to move or upgrade rooms. There was mold and mildew, badly stained curtains, rotting wood and walls, The lady told us that there might be an upgrade to an ocean view room, but they were waiting to see if the party were going to cancel. The upgrade cost was to be almost double what we paid, but that was ok us. What really really bothered us was when we tried to sit outside with our daughter at an open table that night they told us that we could not because it was turning into a bar. Understandable, adults at night want to put their feet in the sand, have a drink, and listen to a good band, so we went inside for a table. The lady told us she would have to ask a manager, even though there were open tables not at the bar area. We told her we were staying at the hotel...but still she would have to ask. She was rude and rolled her eyes as if we were inconveniencing her. We passed and took our money elsewhere. The water stayed warm for 30 seconds in the shower regardless of what time we tried to shower. Their free breakfast was ok, though we were never provided coffee refills or juice refills for our daughter. The beach section isn't the best, but that's not their fault. You just walk a ways down and it's perfect. Like I said, we really wanted to like this hotel, but it's NOT kid friendly or at least they were not friendly to us. The layout is cute and all the plants are wonderful, but it needs a lot of TLC and people who care about it. I wish we had a different experience because it's location is perfect! If you are looking for a beachfront hotel and don't have kids and aren't expecting too much, this hotel will do...but not for us, ever again...and that goes for the restaurant too, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and atmosphere for the right travelers.”
Reviews.Author: markmayster
Reviews.Content: The first time my wife and I visited Playa del Carmen we stayed in a large, all-inclusive resort...and quickly learned that wasn't our style. What we learned we really wanted was the freedom of a smaller boutique hotel centrally located in town where shopping, local dining options and atmosphere were within arm's reach. Fusion is the perfect answer if this is what you're looking for and don't put great focus on the amenities of the actual room. My wife and just need a place to sleep and spend most of the day exploring or on the beach which is in Fusion's back yard. The rooms are clean and no-frills is a fair description but only for the rooms; the rest of the hotel offers plenty of frills. We had no problems at all with noise. Fusion's best asset is the staff who were helpful in every aspect, even prior to our leaving the States. But beyond that, Fusion offers amazing food and stunning views of the ocean in an open-air bar and also has hands-down the best beach-side dining in Playa. Each night guests are treated to live entertainment as they sit at candlelit tables and watch the sunset. Truly priceless if you're into that kind of thing. And don't just take my word for it, Fusion is THE hotspot with the tables filling up nightly. Be sure to have the breakfast special and a massage on the patio. Not at the same time, though, as that might be weird. While it may not be ideal for every situation it is certainly more than ideal for the romantic, adventurous solo traveler or couple. It is our special place and we will return often.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy & Quaint with Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: djcynic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fusion is a great hotel for a no frills stay in downtown Playa del Carmen. Located right off of famous 5th ave, complete with a great casual beach club on site with excellent service! My husband and I stayed over the holidays so it was definitely pricier than the off season rates where I think then, anyone would feel this is a sweet find deal during those times, we payed holiday rates and that was common for all the hotels during those dates. Ah well, I still really enjoyed the cozy colorful room with a pillowtop bed and basic shower was all just fine for us. We wanted to stay near the beach and in downtown over the NYE so this hotel was truly perfect for us. The front staff was friendly and offered a welcome drink our first day and we had the free continental bfast daily which was a simple but a nice start to each day. By day here, we really liked that we were close to bus station to head to Tulum and Coba Mayan Ruins, or many other excursion meet ups or we would just stay at the hotel beach club utilizing the free towels and lounge chairs which Fusion provided. At night there are so many places to head out for dinner along 5th ave, the location really is great for evening walks on the beach or on the ave, we generally would make a circle nightly, always opting to beach walk home to our lovely hotel at night after dinner. If you don't feel like walking just sit at a table in the sand at the Fusion lounge, they have really great food here too. We loved the live music and fireshow entertainment happenings out on the beach in front of the hotel at night and by day the vibe was chill and relaxing.. I recommend the Fusion for those that do not stay in their room much and are more concerned about Location Location.. rather than a pampered luxury style room. Also note yep, as noted.. the hotel has live music at night so if you are one that goes to sleep early this spot may not be for you, there are rooms in the garden area that seem a lil quieter but don't count on it. ;) We had no issues with the noise in the garden after around 2a. When we did have one issue at the hotel the staff was quick to resolve the issue, showing great customer service! I would love to visit here again someday for more fun in Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Location”
Reviews.Author: sasssea
Reviews.Content: I feel a bit mixed in reviewing this hotel. The reception desk staff were fantastic. The rooms were basic and if it hadn't been a beach location hotel, the money paid was too much. Additionally, we had room 9 and it was too close to the beach to sleep early. I was told the first night by waitress staff that we couldn't sit in the beach chairs, because they were all reserved. There were so many open chairs and tables. As a guest of the hotel, I was disappointed by this approach. However, I made my reservation for the next night and enjoyed an ocean view table in the sand the second night of our stay. I love this hotel for the location, the tables in the sand, the reception staff, the entertainment was fantastic (fire shows and belly dancers) and the gardens in the back of the hotel. The room was basic but quaint in a rustic way. I would definitely stay here again, but I would choose to stay off season (to get a lower room price) and in a room away from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your plans/expectations”
Reviews.Author: Page1News
Reviews.Content: A quick and dirty rundown of the Fusion Beach Hotel: The location is right on the beach -- extremely affordable for beachfront accommodations. The hotel also is located right in the center of Playa, which makes walking the famous 5th Ave. really fun and easy. It's a trendy hotel and bar/grill, so live music plays well into the wee hours of the morning. If you like to party until you pass out, Fusion is perfect. If you need to get shut-eye for all-day excursions, you might want to find a different hotel. The room: Our traveling party included two adults and two children, so we needed a room with two beds. The only rooms with two beds are located WAY in the back of the little complex. The room we had was the basic of the basics. It had two double beds, the smallest dorm fridge you can buy, a nightstand, a bathroom with walk-in shower, a TV with cable service and a single air conditioning unit that made the room either too cold or too hot. We had a window opened in the bedroom and a small window in the shower stall. There was no balcony, which made it impossible to hang dry wet swimsuits/clothes. Getting into a cold, wet swimming suit was the pits. The room was a "Garden View," but there wasn't much to see out our window -- a tree and some green ground foliage. Maid service was excellent, and we tipped accordingly. PLEASE TAKE NOTE: THERE ARE NO IN-ROOM SAFES!! The reception desk says they have a safe, but when we went to place my laptop and our passports, we found the laptop did not fit under the desk. There really is no safe at the reception desk: They put your stuff in envelope and write your room number on it. When we retrieved our passports, we were not asked for any ID or anything, so we didn't feel safe leaving anything at the reception desk. So if you have a laptop, passports or any other valuable items, you must either leave them in your room or keep them with you at all times. This made our trip troublesome because I was so afraid someone would come in our room and steal our stuff when we participated in water sports and other activities. If you are looking for a place to just sleep and shower, Fusion is the best place to be. It's like a Motel 6 or Super 8 on the beach. It was fine for us because we spent nearly all our time on the beach or participating in water sports and sightseeing. If you are looking for an up-scale boutique resort feel, you should stay elsewhere. There is no swimming pool, no hot tub or any of the extras. The restaurant/bar: Fusion's food/drinks and service were really good, but very pricey compared to other places -- even within the tourist zone. If you venture two blocks north of 5th Ave., you can find local food vendors, where you can get a ton a food for just USD $3 or $4/person. We ended up walking to Walmart and stocking up on snacks, soda, bottled water and beer and just taking that to the beach with us. It was much, much cheaper than ordering everything from Fusion's restaurant. Presentation Scams: Everywhere you go in Mexico, many, many people will offer you free tickets to parks and even money if you go to some presentation at a "new" hotel resort. These people will try to stop you at the airport, while your walking down 5th Ave., and even in Walmart. Unless you intend to spend $28,000 on a resort room time-share-like program, just ignore these people and keep walking. The presentations take about 2-3 hours, and you get pressured into investing into a resort. While the free ticket offers may sound tempting, it really isn't worth it unless you have nothing better to do than sit in sales presentations during your entire vacation. Bottomline: If you have off-site activities planned, Fusion is a great basic place to rest your head. If you want to stay put and relax with some extras and a little pampering, Fusion is not for you. The only caveat: THERE ARE NO SAFES FOR VALUABLES.

Reviews.Title: “On the Beach in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: BigJuanJohn
Reviews.Content: This beach is just off 6th street on the beach. It is in a perfect location. They have lounge chairs during the day to lay out and wait staff there to serve cold beers (by the bucket) and food. They have a good restaurant and bar. For breakfast they have really good french toast. It is very peaceful during the day and they take really good care of you. I recommend you place your towel to save your place on the lounge chairs at the time you go to breakfast or else you might not get one of the good viewing spots (you know, for people watching). At night the hotel switches the lounging area on the beach to a nice drinking area with live music. The rock band they had on Thanksgiving night was really good. Because they play music at night, you might want one of the rooms in the back of the hotel (room 20 and up). This is the second time we have been there and it really is a good spot. The price is perfect to for a beach front hotel and the great location off of 5th street.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Alejandro
Reviews.Content: Great beach... bar and restaurant not bad at all... you can eat nice food at a reasonable price.... Rooms at not the best but with the money you pay is not that bad.... We ran out water in the morning I was there but it was solved quickly.... From desk is only from 8- 8 pm . . . You can go outside and get the white beautiful beaches just few steps out... Also waling on 5th avenuea is great, nice restaurants and night life just few steps also from hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa B
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, service, music, drinks and food! Great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a fare price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mohas79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the weekend. I had the worst of luck with the weather, it rained all the time. What made this a good experince was the service at the hotel and restaurant. Very friendly staff and great looking girls. The room was very clean and with a lot of space.

Reviews.Title: “We Hit the Jackpot with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tylerblue
Reviews.Content: We researched almost every hotel in Playa del Carmen and this is one of the only ones right on the beach which is a reasonable price. The beach is gorgeous and the hotel has a very laid-back vibe. The one downside is that there is no pool but that really doesn't matter when you have a patch of the Gulf as pretty as this right outside your door. When you stay at Fusion, you feel like you're in the most happening spot as it has a restaurant and nightly entertainment which attract people. The food at the restaurant is excellent. We loved the fish ajillo and ceviche. For breakfast, eggs motulenos is a must. Expect higher prices though; especially for the drinks. They have great bands playing every day and a very impressive firedancing/drumming show later on. We had a room overlooking the beach which was amazing. However, don't expect any sort of quiet as the music from the live bands is very loud on this side. Even earplugs couldn't drown it out. It's a worthy sacrifice to make if you're that kind of person. The front desk staff was very helpful and all spoke perfect English. It doesn't hurt either that all three of them are like super models. They helped us book a tour to Coba which was very convenient and reasonably priced. Last but not least, beach lounges are free! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: JensAas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family on a trip to Mexico and Guatemala in April 2011 and this was the hotel we loved the most at this trip. The hotel has one of the best locations in Playa if you want the closeness to the city and the beach at the same time and you will not miss a pool here. The rooms are good at the price and despite much music from the restaurant at night, this will not be a problem in the "garden view" rooms. The food here is also one of the best we tasted in Playa and the service is excellent with such nice people working here. If I'm coming back to Playa this will be my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KKE11Y
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a small beach-front hotel. The location is perfect and the price is right. Clean rooms, good service and a wonderful bar & beach club. Bands play almost constantly and is a nice touch. If you are an early to bed type, get a garden room (which we had) and you will not hear the music that can be playing till 2:00. This funky little hotel is a jewel in Playa & thier restuarant is excellent too. A couple of minor downsides are; It can be difficult to eat from the low chairs on the beach if you are older & thye DO NOT have safes in the rooms (at least not my two rooms). We used the safe at the front desk with no problems. This is a great little hotel, with plenty of action and is perfect for the 25-40 crowd (although I am 50+) and a good choice for any age.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RandJHalifax_NS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything I could have hoped for after reading the reviews and looking at the website. It was actually better! The room was clean, funky, and private. We were in #4 at the very back, 2nd floor. It felt like we were in our own little treehouse. The gardens are so lush and tropical, it added such atmosphere. The restaurant, beachfront tables, and loungechairs were perfect. The beach was amazing - beautiful sand and the town cleans it every day. After many walks both ways on the beach, I realized we had the perfect stretch of beach in the perfect location. 5th ave is 30 seconds away, the ferry to Cozumel is about a 5 minute walk. I have done two all-inclusives before, and never will again. The freedom to eat wherever we wanted was spectacular, and every meal on 5th avenue was filling and delicious. The drinks are pricey (same as N.A.) but they weren't watered down like at a resort, so it kind of evens itself out. Food and drinks are about the same as home.... We walked to Wal-Mart (very close as well) and stocked up on alcohol and snacks for the room and drank on the balcony. The staff are so friendly - from the hotel desk to the beachfront. They seemed so genuine and took care of every need so seamlessly. I cannot say enough good about this place. If I return to Playa, it will be to the Fusion 100%. Go! You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: benben892
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fusion June 28-July 2nd. The staff was freindly and helpful. You are 1 min. away from 5th ave. with all its shops, bars and resturants. I did'nt know what to expect from the beach, but was more than suprised to see it was one of the nices stretches of the sand in that area. Much cleaner and better taking care of than many of the high end resorts in the area. The ferry to cancun is also just a few min walk from the hotel, and worth the trip! If you get a chance they offer 1 hr. massages for $25 at the hotel beach. I highly recommend this! It was great to wake up eat some breakfast and have a complimentary Bloodymary while getting my massage. I will be back for sure!!! I would also highly recommend the Fusion to anybody looking for a small quaint hotel on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Alice0113
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Fusion hotel from the 20th-23rd of June. We stayed at a much larger, all-inclusive resort a couple blocks away, where were married just a few days prior. We wanted to experience something a little different than the run-of-the-mill all-inclusive, and Fusion was absolutely perfect. The staff is very friendly. There is nightly entertainment, such as live bands and fire shows. We had every intention of visiting 5th avenue for a taste of the night-life, but Fusion was plenty entertainment for us. We did, however, take advantage of great shopping close by. The food is amazing, and every meal was extraordinary. We stayed in room 17, which is ocean-front with a magical view of the beautiful beach. We had a quaint patio with a couple of chairs and hammocks. The room was spacious, no complaints about the bathroom. The mattress was a tad firm, but that was not a problem for me. My only real complaint are the drink prices, way too high. I would recommend buying your bev of choice at a local supermarket and drinking that in the room/porch. We will definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this little beachfront hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jdv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fusion the end of April, it was the second time we've stayed there. We love the service, the staff is very attentive and friendly. The food is very good, and having it served to you right on the beach is wonderful, you don't even have to leave your lounge chair! Our room was very basic, but very clean. We were in room 26, back in the garden section, and it was very quiet at night. The beach is beautiful! The location of the Fusion is perfect, right in the heart of Playa del Carmen. We just love this casual little beachfront hotel, and we would definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a reasonably priced vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for this Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Emmylousue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fusion for 4 nights in April. We got in around 7pm and the party was in full swing. Our check-in was easy (I had booked through Hotels.com) and within minutes we were lugging our stuff up 3 flights of stairs and basking in the happiness of "we are here". The room had a great set-up and we were ocean-front. Nice size bathroom, sitting area, closet and fridge. The patio was just the perfect size for the table and 2 chairs. The AC definitely works well here - and after the 1st night found that we didn't quite need it as low as we thought. There is only the sheet and a thin blanket on the bed, I'm sure if we had asked we could have gotten another but we just turned up the AC and were fine. My mom said the bed was a little too hard for her liking, but I personally had no problems with it. We did have a couple of little hiccups but nothing a good drink didn't fix. On our first day, we came back from breakfast and were changing to go to the beach. I was going to make a quick bathroom run before we headed out but that turned into 20 minutes stuck inside the BR while my mom tried getting me out, failed, and had to run downstairs to get someome to come get me out. I don't know what he did - but he got me out. Our fix for that: Mom and I never shut the BR door again! We laughed that it could only happen to one of us. Another hiccup was the shower. I think the shower head just needs a good cleanig with some CLR and it would be fine - but it sprayed EVERYWHERE. The entire BR floor would be soaked after we would get cleaned up. I mentioned this to them as we were leaving b/c really it wasn't THAT big of a deal, but something they should look into. Last hiccup was the toilet, and this I don't believe is the hotel's fault. We had several days where we thought our toilet was clogging, but when we mentioned it to the front desk they said the water had been off in the area. So our belief is that was going on each time. No biggie, it would right itself throughout the day. The shows at Fusion are as spectacular as everyone says. We loved the bands and the belly dancers each evening. The fire show was a big hit as well. The only thing I didn't really like - and maybe it's just me - but after the belly dancer would perform she would walk around and ask for tips. I just didn't like feeling put on the spot. If she had just set the jar next to the stage it would have been fine. Some have complained of the noise associated with the beach front rooms during the evening shows but we had no problems. We slept great every night we were there. The beach in front of the hotel is fantastic and we loved it everyday. It's a great mix of locals and tourists and the noise level is fine, the atmosphere is one of just fun. Also, they have massages set up on the stage during the day. The food at Fusion is great and we ate there twice. The food prices aren't bad, but the drink prices seemed high. Our tab for one order of nachos and 6 drinks was $100 US one day - that just seemed high to me. The location for Fusion is great. It's right off 5th Ave. and beach front. You can't get any better than that. We loved walking so much and having so much to do right near us. It was great. All in all we really liked the Fusion Hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone that asked - as a matter of fact I think a friend has already booked for later this year. I don't know that we will go back as this was our first time Non-AI and we are excited to try new things, but we definitely liked being there and the experiences it gave us.

Reviews.Title: “Great botique service with amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: MNChan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller, quaint hotel right on the beach for some sun and relaxation. Little did I know, how impressed I would be with the hotel. The location was perfect; right on a beautiful beach and close to 5th Street. Everyone from the manager, the wait staff and even the cleaning personnel showed a commitment excellent customer service and making me feel welcome. My initial and subsequent emails to the hotel regarding availability and arrangement of transportation were responded to immediately by the wonderful office staff! The food at the hotel was amazing. Some people had said the food is a little pricey, but the variety and quality of the food is worth it. The late afternoon and evening beach front entertainment were great. It was nice to be able to sit out under the stars and listen to music, watch belly dancing or the fire show. I have traveled a substantial amount and this is one of few places I would return to and cannot wait to go back! If you are looking for a comfortable boutique like hotel with a great atmosphere with personalized service right on the beach this is the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome beach front atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: NaughtyMorty
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in Fusion in June 2006 and have had the pleasure of 3 more visits over the last 3 years (in April and May respectively) - it has never disappointed and has always, in fact, exceeded expectations with continual improvements and additions to the hotel / bar / restaurant year on year! Fantastic beach bar (with gorgeous new traditional Mexican palapa roof added this year - creates awesome atmosphere at all times of day and evening) and beach restaurant for brilliant variety of delicious food to cover all tastes. Great live music from the very talented bands that play on the beach stage each night - the only live music on the beach in Playa, I think - and excellent fire shows too - always an entertaining evening and you can choose to get as involved as you like, it's never too imposing. Very comfortable rooms and really attentive and helpful staff have always made my stay extremely relaxing - the awesome mojitos have helped too! Thanks for yet another wonderful stay, I look forward to stopping by again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Funky beach side comfort and beauty”
Reviews.Author: FoodLover82_10
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. I have two small children 3 and 7 who had a great time playing on the beach in front. The casual atmosphere made it great as I didn't have to worry about the kids being kids to the same degree as some other hotels. The food was excellent and reasonably priced as were the rooms. There was something on the menu for everyone. Every night we would go for a walk on 5th come back eat dinner and then listen to the live music while the kids played next to us on the beach. I highly recommend Fusion Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a beach! What a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dunk60
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to stay 5 nights (March 30-April 4, 2011, as we wanted a small boutique-feel hotel on the beach. We're a gay couple who are seasoned travellers to Playa, but had 'concerns' about staying, as we couldn't find any reviews from other same sex couples, but be assured there was no issue. Overall our review should be 4.8 out of 5! Location- EXCELLENT! Close to everything, right on the beach and lots to do. Value/ Room/ Sleep Quality- Damn amazing for being right on the beach and a continental breakfast was included. Cleanliness- Great overall; 4/5 as the room windows needed cleaning to remove dirt, but really not a issue. Service- Staff was friendly and helpful. Front desk girls very polite and always were there to assist. 4/5 as the servers needed to asked for a second cup of coffee during breakfast and the the Happy Hour margaritas changed daily from frozen to on the rocks (consistency needed). This hotel is a must visit! The owners were on the property all the time, property very well maintained and lots to do in the evening right at the hotel. The restaurant was delicious and the area was a great place. The bar had loud music at night, so be warned. Beach views might come with some noise and garden views come with less, but things wind down for a good sleep (don't expect silence, as you are on vacation right on the beach, so enjoy!) Libby the hotel dog was lovely. FUSION IS A MUST VISIT FOR EVERYONE!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juanvzla
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best beach hotel I've ever stayed. I went with my fiance and It has an excellent location, rooms, food and drinks. The Staff is very friendly and helpful. Oh yes! and the beach is reallly close to your room where every evening salsa, rock and samba bands plays, even a belly dancer and fire show. It really is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, super staff, fabulous food/service and great fun!!”
Reviews.Author: marshl4501
Reviews.Content: Karen and I had a great time while at Fusion. We stayed one week between March/April '11. Many thanks to Kim who was so helpful and met all our needs. The restaurant & bar was excellent and their wait service perfect for us. Thank you Giovanna, Mariann and Andrea. We will miss you. For travelers who are troubled about toilet plumbing that doesn't allow for flushable tissue, this may not be your hotel. Think of it as being on ship. Wasn't an issue for us. Fusion is a fun boutique hotel with hip, beautiful people and staff. And will always be our choice while in Playa. Brad English Kansas City, MO

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: PeterMclane
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed so much our stay at Fusion. This was our 2nd stay it is very well located and for the price is one of the best options. It might not be the cleanest and best hotel but it fits the bill. I would recommended it as a cheap option.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the weekend. Loved having to stay right on the beach. The rooms are very basic but that wasnt a big deal to us. The bed was pretty stiff but we expect that from a hotel of this type. The restaurant served good food. The drinks are a little pricey. More than what you would pay in the US. The beach is nice. They provide lounge chairs and umbrellas for the guest. The evening live music is nice entertainment. We stayed in garden room #29 and the music didnt bother us much. You could barely hear it. Our room had a large patio. We asked the front desk if we could use a lounge chair to lay out on our patio but they told us that was not possible. It would have been nice to have some lounge chairs in such a big space. I made the best of it and put my large towels out and still made use of the space but it was certainly not as comfy as having a lounge chair. Our friends stayed in room #28 and they never had hot water all 4 days they were there. I would still recommend this hotel due to the beach front hotel and the price. We usually stay at the Shangri-La Hotel but it wasnt within our budget this time. We will definitely return to the Fusion.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: mzbuttons
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fusion Hotel, because the package price from Expedia was too good to pass up. As other’s have said the hotel is pretty basic and after reading other reviews I realized all of the rooms are upgraded differently. We had the two story room thus we had had two televisions; though neither was a flat screen and also one of the following reviews said they had only one towel and no hair dryer. We had a ton of towels daily and there was definitely a hair dryer hanging. Either way, on to my review: We thoroughly enjoyed Fusion. You cannot beat free breakfast, and two for one mimosas, right on the beach every morning. The location is ideal being that you are right off of 5th Avenue, close to a million restaurants and Playa’s nightlife. I will say beware of how loud Fusion can be. For us, the band playing at night was no problem because we were often in the crowd enjoying the band; and by the time you get back to Fusion, after a night of clubbing, Fusion has long shut down. However, I must note that the walls are just really thin in the rooms. You can hear people walking by and if they are standing in your room. It didn’t really bother me, but it is something I took note of. Beyond that the beach is great. Of course you get special service since you are staying at the hotel and it’s a great place to hang out for the day. I must say we did have a problem with the restaurant though. I ordered a drink, from the menu, that when I tasted did not like. I sent it back immediately (I only took two sips) and wanted to replace the drink. It took us over 35 minutes to get them to replace the drink. They kept saying that even though I didn’t like the drink that I would still have to pay for it. Which was ridiculous. Finally, the manager made a rude comment stating that she didn’t want “any more trouble” from us so she would just replace the drink (you would think I had asked for my money back, I simply wanted a new drink!) Since that’s all we were asking for in the first place we said thank you but I was irritated at the implication that WE were troublemakers over something so minor. We did move on from that day and continued to enjoy the restaurant. Other short notes: The front desk personnel are great; they gave us the great idea to travel to Isla Mujueres for the day and we LOVED it. We are definitely going back there. The room was basic, but clean. We had a problem with our air conditioner the first day and it was fixed immediately. The cleaning people were great and thorough. We did find one huge roach in the bathroom, I screamed! But, it was only one and in that area, unsurprising. Overall, really liked the hotel, got a good deal and if I get another really good deal, I would totally go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, entertaining and great location”
Reviews.Author: DiLoLa
Reviews.Content: If I'll go back to Mexico, I'll definetely stay a couple of days at Fusion. They have great service (who speak english), nice food - and you can eat on the beach - and the atmosphere is pleasent (cosy, informal but professionel).

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: kastone66
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Fusion. Great little beach front property. Clean with basic necessities. Friendly, attentive staff. Great food. Was there for a wedding at a all-inclusive hotel that was a ton more money. Everybody from the wedding wished they stayed at the Fusion. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rollingmercury
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fusion last year for one week. I had stayed at another hotel (very basic with very low rates) for the first week of my stay in Playa but ended up discovering Fusion so I decided to switch for my second week. At the time (April 2010), the owner offered a discount as I was staying longer than 5 days (and maybe also because I was also traveling alone?). I ended up paying around $60.US/night. I was excited about staying there again this year but was very disappointed to find out the rate was to be $1700. for 16 nights...! and no discount! I was told they had a discount at $67.50 a few months back but that discount didn't apply at the time of my traveling. I know it's not terribly expensive when you think this hotel is located directly on the beach, close to everything, offers great affordable beach massages, excellent food and great entertainment during the day and at night. The rooms are clean but basic and some can be quite noisy if you're a light sleeper. I was quite suprised they no longer offered any kind of discount as most hotels (even some of the smallest ones) in Playa will offer a discount if you're staying 7 days or more...So, I ended up booking somewhere else, a smaller hotel (with great reviews), less than one block to the beach, a tiny walking distance to the 5th Ave, with a pool and a kitchenette for $67./night including taxes and the promo discount. So, as much as I loved Fusion, I'm happy to see that there are other nice friendly hotels in Playa who will take into consideration you're staying for a longer period of time and offer a discount! Always nice when you're traveling alone and on a small budget!

Reviews.Title: “Best little hotel with a super vibe!”
Reviews.Author: Canucksters
Reviews.Content: Initially we stayed at the Fusion for one night enroute to Belize. Very easy to find as we took the ADO bus from Cancun Airport into Playa del Carmen, then hired a bike cart to take our suitcases to the Fusion on Calle 6. We were so impressed by that one night's stay that we booked for 5 additional nights on our exit from Belize. Great service from front desk staff, all email reservations done quickly and correctly. We simply loved this little hotel. We have stayed in AI's in Cancun and PDC but the Fusion's personalized service and intimate setting won our hearts and wallets. Highlights: attentive staff, great beach club, great location off 5th Ave, and a great roster of live entertainment. If you are the quiet type ask for a garden room (we stayed in Room 9 and Room 3, Room 3 was church quiet). Great vibe, even during a cold front, the Fusion has perfected the recipe for fun. We will be back for sure. While there, check out the uber cool posters by staffer Diana. The Fusion: Not fancy, but fun. Mucho fun! Cynthia & Randy, Dawson Creek, BC

Reviews.Title: “Fusion-Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: greggt2
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a long weekend and had a great time. the Fusion bar staff was awesome and everyone always had a smile on and was willing to help in any way. beach massage was very good so i recommend that and the late night nachos... awesom location directly on the beach and centrally located to anything you want to do in Playa del Carmen. Fire shows every night and two bands a day. Do it. PS the only reason i lowered the stars on the sleep quality is because the bands play late and you can definitly hear them from the beach front rooms, me i dont mind i can sleep through anything, but for the light sleepers get a room closer to the rear of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “It will be hard to say goodbye....”
Reviews.Author: Soupdujour
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Fusion Hotel following recommendations from 3 friends that had visited on separate occassions. We usually opt for a Carribean AI resort when seeking a beach holiday but with only 25 rooms we found the Fusion so much more friendly and accomodating. It has a really good feel about it which can only be understood once you have stayed there - so get booked up.....! The rooms are quite basic compared to large resorts, however they get the basics right. Good comfortable beds, lots of storage space, efficient air conditioning and large ceiling fan, good shower and as mentioned in other reviews, a large fridge which was very useful. It's only a 25 metre walk to the beach so you are hardly going to spend much time in there anyway, otherwise you might as well stay at home. The food is very good at the Fusion, all freshly prepared and the service was fantastic. There is waiter service during the day and in the evening on the beach and you would never have to wait any longer than 5 mins for a waiter to pass and get their attention. We ate at 2 restaurants on 5th Avenue (the main drag for restaurants/bars/shops) but were never as satisfied as we were when we ate at the hotel. We would especially recommend the Quesidillas and Calamari. Add to this the great nightly entertainment on offer and you will see just how much more value you get for your money than staying in a large "sterile" resort. Also, WIFI available in the reception area if you need to stay in contact with the world. Getting to the hotel from Cancun airport we got a coach. We used ADO (their desk is on the left as you exit customs) and their coaches leave every 30-45mins. It cost $18 each return, the coach was air conditioned, showed movies and took about an hour to get to PDC. The hotel is a 5 min walk from the bus station. It was a very smooth journey. So to summarise, the hotel is very good value for money, fantastic staff and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy923
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Playa for our Honeymoon and after much discussion he convinced me to skip the all inclusive hotel options for this hotel on the beach. I was hesitant partly because of the cost ( I thought it would be dirty and sketchy) but I am so glad I listened to him. We had a garden room that was plenty quiet, the ac was WONDERFUL, it was clean, cozy, and cute. The people that worked there were all incredibly friendly and helpful. For some reason we never tried the continental breakfast but ate a great omelet almost every morning - oh, and their iced coffee and fresh fruit smoothies! My favorite things about the hotel: 1. RIGHT on the beach. 2. Buckets of beer and quacamole brought right out to you while sitting in a great chair on the beach. 3. The really fun but laid back nightlife while also being romantic. 4. Right in the middle of fifth street (the main drag). My only complaints were the pillows - but I'm picky about pillows and could have asked for different ones and choose not too. And the mattress was really firm - but my husband loves firm ones so he was happy. We had an amazing honeymoon in Playa Del Carmen and when we go back we would for sure stay at the Fusion Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LilyHouston
Reviews.Content: Our stay was at Playa del Carmen Fusion Hotel from July 28-Aug 2, 2010. The service was excellent and not to mention the price was very reasonable. A special thanks to Kim Stoeve (reception) who helped me plan my stay from the start here in Houston to the very end. Thank you Kim!! Our private transportation arranged by Kim was on time and very friendly gave me lots of tips and places to see. Hotel Fusion is small, nothing fancy like a Hilton Hotel but it is clean and at night very lively. One of the few hotels that have music and drinks outside by the ocean until 2am. The food at Fusion was also good. We love the atomsphere. We did not need a car to go anywhere, taxi's were available at the corner and the shopping was within walking distance. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Beach hotel with a garden view”
Reviews.Author: ScubaCF
Reviews.Content: Our initial communications with the Fusion Hotel was a good sign of things to come. We E-mailed the Fusion Hotel about availability and Kim got right back with us. We had told her that we were doing our rescue diver course during our stay at their hotel and we requested a quiet room in the garden, which is in the back of the hotel and away from the bar area. When we arrived at the Fusion, we were greeted by Kim in the reception area, who showed us our room, which was in the very back, room number 3. The room has a shared porch with the room next door, and was equipped with two double size beds, ac, ceiling fan, desk, TV, separate vanity area, big shower, refrigerator, and closet. The mattresses are new and very comfortable (not the hard beds you expect in Mexico). The décor in the room is tastefully done. We had two people in the room and felt comfortable. Things you can leave at home: hair dryer (can borrow one from the front desk); soap, shampoo, beach towels, iron and iron board (can borrow from the front desk). Wal-Mart is not too far from the hotel (which has a grocery store). Breakfast is served every morning after 8 a.m. Coffee, tea, juice, toast and croissant is served for the continental breakfast. They give you cards for the beach towels and if you need a safe, they have one located at the front desk. Maid service was excellent. We cannot talk about the food at the restaurant, as we only had drinks at the bar, but the staff was great and we really enjoyed the band. Internet is available in the lobby area (bring your laptop). Beach chairs are also included, but by the time we got back from our dive course we were too tired. The Fusion has some tours, and they offer massages on the beach (or your room) at great prices. The gardens are well kept. You can smell the flowers while walking back to your room. At night it was very quiet in our room, the music was very faint. Overall, the location, service, and room was very nice and we enjoyed our stay. Kim also told us where to go to bargain with a taxi driver for our trip down to Akumal. We want to thank the great staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation Weekend at Fusion”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDeb50
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for all inclusive, this isn't it! If you're looking for fun, friendly, basic do want you want vacation, you couldn't stay at a better place. Stayed for a long weekend with my daughter in January, and I was a little skeptical when she booked b/c she's one that would backpack thru Mexico on a budget. Fusion was fun, relaxing, fantastic location on the beach w/plenty of chairs, dancing & dining on the beach, variety of music/bands almost all the time, friendly staff who diligently perform their tasks without being told & always with a smile! I thought I would miss a pool, but there is so much to do and the water is so beautiful, I never gave it thought. Close to shopping, transportation, lots of restaurants. Had room on top floor overlooking bar/restaurant w/view of ocean & enjoyed sitting on balcony taking it all in! Food delicious, fire dancers fun to watch. Late night music/noise never bothered us b/c we were either too tired & slept through it, or we were right there in the middle of it. Thanks Fusion for four memorable days!

Reviews.Title: “Fusion was EXACTLY what we were looking for in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: NICKIOSU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusion for the 1st week in June. It was exactly what we wanted. We wanted to stay on the beach at a small hotel that had plenty to offer, and "Fusion" was perfect. The service was super friendly on all accounts, Hotel, restaurant, beach. Our room was spacious and nice and cool for those hot summer days. We had a wonderful balcony overlooking the restaurant/bar area and with a great view all the way to the ocean. We loved sitting on our balcony drinking cervesa and listening to the array of bands they had nightly (all were wonderful). Our favorite was the Salsa band, they were high energy and so were all the patrons dancing. We have NO complaints whatsoever. We grabbed two spots on the beach everyday and relaxed, the service at the beach chairs is also wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel. We miss Liby (hotel dog) already, She is adorable. Thanks for a wonderful stay!! PS. The food at fusion was some of the best we had that week. We ate there many times.

Reviews.Title: “January happy times”
Reviews.Author: Woody22
Reviews.Content: Hey, just realised I hadn't wrote a review from our trip to Fusion.... All I can say is...go there!!! On the beach, chilled out, ok prices, great food and drinks, cool late bar and beach entertainment....we had a great time here, stayed for 2 weeks...Jan 18th on....weather great....people, food, beers, nightime...all as good as you need... Check out Al's beer bucket, the girls are simply so welcoming and Corona's are so cheap, food in El Fogon (not far from Wal Mart) but the best restaurant by far was El Bistro at La Tortuga Hotel.....wow...check out the Filet Mignon, Alaskan Snow Crabs...I have eaten some great steaks but this place is at least as good as anywhere else I have tasted...and about £10 for the main course... We hired a scooter, took on a week of travelling about, visted Cenotes, beaches, Cancun (swam with dolphins in wet n wild 8 out of 10) and generally just chilled. Stay away from 5th ave for food and drinks, its about half the price and twice as nice if you move away from the tourist trap and 5 mins off the main drag.... We absolutely adored this place, Fusion and Playa are great, very 'travelly' in the day time and plenty of bars and clubs at night, locals friendly, easy to exist and great UK winter weather... If you fly to Cancun, get the bus to Playa, its about £6 each, just outside the airport terminal and gets you there the same time as a taxi...just at about 1/7th of the price!! Enjoy...its an amazing place...oh yeah, Libby the hotels dog is a nice addition, she's just chilled and milling about on the beach or in the hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, but a bit loud”
Reviews.Author: Corkey450
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Fusion from March 7 to 14th and had an amazing time. The hotel is directly in front of the water and conveniently the city 're-did' the beaches in some areas so there was over 200 feet for gorgeous white sand to lounge in. All of the staff members, including waitresses and bartenders, were very helpful and spoke English well. The location is fabulous. One street away from 5th avenue, we walked everywhere. We also booked a few day trips, many of which we were picked up at the hotel instead of having to take public transportation. Again, the staff were helpful in suggesting different day trips and excursions. The rooms are what you pay for. As you can read in many of the reviews, they are simple. When we arrived, we checked into room 12 (a 'garden' room) at the price of $90 a night. Unfortunately this room is in the middle of the hotel, almost all of the other guests have to walk past this room to get to theirs. There is a lot of foot traffic, not to mention the very loud bands that play past midnight many evenings. Perhaps I was naive in thinking we would get a nice, quiet room by the beach for such a cheap price. We spoke with the woman at the front desk and upgraded to room 19 (the owners usual room). My boyfriend paid for the upgrade, so I am not sure what it cost, but it was well worth it. Room 19 has a balcony looking out to the ocean, a HUGE bed, beautiful wood ceiling, but it also very loud. Moral of the story... the music is amazing when you want to be awake and listening, but not when you need to sleep because you are getting up early to tour the Mayan ruins. Bring ear plugs! All in all, we enjoyed the hotel and would think about coming back depending on when that is. If you are a young couple and/or like music and being active, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Funky beachside hotel- alot to like”
Reviews.Author: lewseph
Reviews.Content: PCD is a great place and the Fusion is nice if your priorities are not luxurious appointments and pampering. Their location just off of 5th Avenue and on a lovely stretch of public beach is terrific. For our family of four, this was probably the most reasonable place that we could find. There is continual music (harpist in the AM, reggae & salsa in the PM), a decent restaurant and a very friendly staff. Our duplex room had been renovated and was decently comfortable. The music didn't keep us awake though it was an issue for others. The staff is helpful in the informal manner of this great place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: DebP
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa del Carmen numerous times and we choose Fusion for its beach location. We were not disappointed. We were concerned about the recent reviews and addressed them with Kim via email. She was always quick to respond to my numerous inquiries. Our room was #3 in the garden. Our first night we heard music but that is because we left the windows open, the following 6 nights we closed the windows and turned on the AC. We ate most of our breakfasts & lunches at Fusion, portions are large. We would split the omelets along with the continental breakfast. Lunches on the beach, again splitting shrimp tacos, quesadilla's and a caprese salad. Food was excellent! Service was great....from maid staff, food service to the front staff. A special shout out to Sergio who worked food/drink service on the beach. We miss his smile! We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Be selective in picking room”
Reviews.Author: Enis
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from the Fusion Hotel. The hotel has 20 rooms--l2 have tile bathrooms and floor---8 have cement floors and walls. My friend had the tiled room and I had the garish green cement room. In the tiled room the water tank never filled for flushing (they were going to send a person to fix the pressure but never did). Therefore, every time my friend had to ;put in the water tank 10 glasses of water. My friend had room 12 which was noisy--- very close to the front office and the band . I had a garden room which was quiet. On our last night we ate our dinner at the hotel---during the night we both had food poisoning. Previously we had daily breakfast and sometimes lunch and was never bothered. The hotel supples no bed spreads but we went to WalMart and bought our own which we needed because the rooms are cold at night at this time of year. All of the employees are exemplary -- cannot say enough about Kim and Diana plus the cheerful maids and the dining room employees (bring coffee immediately,etc.) I would give the Fusion Hotel a ** (two star) rating.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kassnmatt
Reviews.Content: We just finished our 7 night stay at fusion and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there!! My boyfriend and I stayed in room #16 which was the partial ocean view but mainly overlooked the bar, which was good though because you can see what's going on downstairs and If it's busy at the bar! And the noise isn't really a problem if you've had a few drinks before bed! :) It has the most perfect location on the beach and there's nothing better than lying on the banana lounges and having cocktails to overlook the beautiful surroundings and live music at night! The food at the restaurant was great aswell, the only thing I would maybe suggest is to possibly lower the bar prices and food for guests staying there, or, lower the room rates a little to justify paying the restaurant! otherwise it's really good! Everyone that worked there was so nice and always smiling and even helped us touch up on our spanish!! :) Kim who works at the front of house is soooo lovely and helpful, she helped organise a car to pick us up from the airport and then take us back to our next hotel in cancun! All in all.. We had the best time at fusion and would love to come back again! Thanks for having us guys xo

Reviews.Title: “Location: Great, Rooms: LOUSY”
Reviews.Author: jambie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from 10 days in Playa and based on my brother's experience a couple years ago booked at the Fusion. First the good: great location, beautiful beach, pretty good food although the continental breakfast is the same every day and not that great. Beds weren't great but not awful either.The hightlight was the harp player that played during the breakfast hour - incredible! Unfortunately, for us, the bad out weighed the good. Our first two nights were in a tiny "garden view" (there was no view of the garden - the "balcony" overlooked the road outside and the window overlooked an airconditioning unit on top of the roof) room. It was basically a backpacker hostel type of room - grimy feeling (a wad of gum on one of the walls!) and stunk like sewer. I could have maybe overlooked the room quality if it werent so loud - between the band playing until after midnight, the partiers leaving the bar area and the noise from the street, even with ear plugs we got no sleep. After two nights we were moved to another room which was equally grimy (almost all the walls were scuffed up like someone had thrown dirty shoes against them) but was slightly quieter. We were only able to stay in that room for 4 nights and would then have to move another 2 times during our 9 night stay, so we found another hotel a block away - absolutely lovely, clean, great bed, quiet AND $20 night less. My impression is that the management/owners are making their money from the restaurant and bar and don't really care about the hotel. Yes, the location is great, but so are many places. I guess if you have low expectations around cleanliness and quiet you won't be disappointed, but we just expected so much more than we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great People, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoTandT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusion for 11 days in January in a "garden room" (#3). We asked for one of the quieter rooms due to the reviews that said it could be noisy there because of the nightly live music. We couldn't hear much of the music sounds from the room but could occassionally hear things from the 5th Avenue--it wasn't bad at all, and with the A/C on, it covered noises nicely. We will stay here again. The people working at this place are super accommodating. Beds in Mexico can be on the very "firm" side and ours was here. So, because of a bad back, we mentioned it to the front desk people and they had the maids put some extra padding on the bed which helped immensely. About halfway through our stay the rooms ALL got new mattresses and they were much better! The room was pretty spacious and had high ceilings. The garden is really beautiful and a pleasure to step out into, although I imagine if you aren't concerned about the noise, waking up to the ocean view would be even better! This hotel is ON the beach, and its a nice beach. While we were there, some heavy equipment came through that was working on making the beach bigger as it had eroded away from the hurricane 2 years ago. It closed our beach for 4 days or so which was a bummer, but there was no way the staff could have known it was going to happen. It was quite an interesting show to watch--a big ship was sucking sand off the bottom of the ocean and pumping it through huge pipes to the beaches and then big machinery spread and leveled it. We did get a discount because of the beach closure, which was nice and helped pay for the cost of going to the other beach clubs during those days. There is a restaurant and bar here too. It's funky and perfect. Open air dining, bright colorful lights at night. We ate at many places on 5th Avenue since we were there 11 days, and in all honesty, the food was the best right there at the Fusion Hotel. And it was cheaper than many of the places we ate. The drinks were also great and the live music was festive and mostly really good! Love the reggae and the drumming! The fire show at night was definitely worth seeing too. We were impressed by the bus system for getting around. You can take the ADO bus from Cancun to the Juarez and 5th Ave station for like $10 and once there, there are these guys on tricycles and its about $3 to have them carry you and your luggage to the hotel, (but these guys don't speak much English, so write the name of your hotel for them...we said "Fusion", he understood "Fisherman" and we ended up at the wrong place when we got there!) Going back to the station when leaving, we just walked (our luggage had wheels) to the bus station. It's only a few blocks and we shopped 5th Avenue on the way. We also took the ADO to Tulum one day and to Xcaret another day. It was easy and cheap and very comfortable. If you're on a budget, don't hesitate to take it. We took the Collectivo a couple of times too and that is a fine way to travel as well, but if you'd rather, the taxi's are EVERYWHERE. One other point, if you go to this area, do not miss Xcaret, and try to allow 2 days for it. We went one day and didn't get to see everything. This place is amazing...underground river and cave snorkeling, gorgeous beach to hang out on, hammocks, swim with dolphins, see the sea turtles, butterflies, parrots, all kinds of animals, horse show...I can't even tell you everything because there is so much. But at night there is a Grand Spectacular--you go to a beautiful theatre where they reenact the ball games of the Mayans among other things, but this was so incredible that you just have to see it to believe it. We also went to Chichen Itza on a guided tour which included stopping and getting into a Cenote on the way back, and that was one of the coolest things! It was stunningly beautiful and very refreshing! OK, back to the Fusion Hotel...we recommend staying here. It's casual, funky, friendly, tasty, beachy, excellently located, fun, affordable...and we hope to get back there someday! Thanks to all the great people at Fusion for a wonderful vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!! Great Staff!! Great Restaurant!!”
Reviews.Author: FairfieldDan
Reviews.Content: Being an experienced PDC traveller I can tell you that you won't find a better hotel on the beach for the money. We stayed in Feb of 07 and loved it. They have since renovated the bar which I visited on a recent trip where we stayed in an all-inclusive for a stag party. The owners are always present and very friendly. Kim is excellent to deal with for reservations. Recently in 2009 we had to cancel our vacation and she was very quick to refund our deposit. When we did stay, we had an upstairs room with a very basic but clean room. The AC worked fine and there was hot water.(sometimes hard to find in other hotels). The breakfast was adequate and don't forget....FREE! Chairs were always available to guests. We were never asked to leave a chair but we were usually off the beach by 3 PM. Centrally located to 5th avenue bars and restaurants. The restaurant on site was great. Best fish tacos ever!!!! Thanks again for the great stay(even though it was 3 years ago!) We will definitely visit you again!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Playa”
Reviews.Author: Slhollen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fusion over New Year's - this was the best spot on the beach in our opinion. The location is great - the beach is clean. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Sergio was our server nearly every afternoon he was so kind and friendly! This hotel is beautiful and unique. I love the courtyard type garden setting. We had a room towards the back and had no problems with noise at night. We felt like we were in our own little villa. Great atmosphere by day and by night - the food in the restaurant is excellent as well. Prices were very reasonable! Love the house dog :) We will definitely come back!! Thank You for a great family vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff & Great Location, Terrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jimnjan
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel to spend the last 2 nights of our vacation because it sounded like a fun place to end our vacation. Live nightly entertainment, right on the beach, close to 5th Ave and the reviews I read were good. We knew that we would sacrifice amenities due to the location vs the price and had seen an online photo of one of the rooms so we knew that they were sparsely furnished. First let me say that the restaurant, food, atmosphere, and all of the staff were very nice and helpful. The rooms on the other hand were not. Our first room, # 13, was not far from the lobby (or the band). It was very small, only walkways around the bed. The view out our window looked into an outside storage closet and general storage area, the shower dripped nonstop all day and night and had been doing so for a long time as the shower floor was stained. The soap dish in the shower had a hole in the bottom so the soap would drop through to the floor, all tile was in need of work. Not only did we hear the band from inside our room while they were playing, but we were also able to hear them chatting outside our door as they picked up their things at the end of their night, as they had stored them just outside our door. The next day we decided to find lodging elsewhere, but ended up staying when offered compensation and were moved upgraded room, #25. It was a larger room with a garden view, farther from the lobby. It was an improvement. As we settled into the room we noticed that the bathroom light didn't work so we reported it. By 7 PM, when we returned, we still had no lights. Reported it again, grabbed a bite to eat and came back to find a green shaded desk lamp that was plugged into the bathroom outlet which is located outside of the bathroom on the left side of the doorway and the lamp was placed inside the bathroom, on the sink top , which is on the right side of the room. This meant that the lamp cord ran across the doorway just below shoulder level. With our new lighting we were now able to see that there were no towel bars, just large patches of non sanded Spackle where a towel bar once was, similar patches around the shower faucets, all sorts of small holes in the tile above the sink and lots of "stuff" on the tile walls under the sink and at that level all around the bathroom in general. At this distance you could still hear the band at night. I think that this hotel would be best enjoyed by a younger (or not so young), party crowd type person, that enjoys a very laid back atmosphere with good (and loud) nightly entertainment. Someone that doesn't need much sleep and is just looking for a bed to crash in.

Reviews.Title: “Vibe not so great...more like a hippy hostel.”
Reviews.Author: Reba76
Reviews.Content: We were pretty excited about Fusion after reading great reviews online. Here's what we thought: Location: Great...right on the beach, 30 seconds from the main area (most people want this...though it is super touristy), 3 blocks from the convenient bus stop. Beach: really nice. Unfortunately for our entire stay, there was construction on the beach to make it wider, and you were not allowed to be on it except for at night. NOT the hotel's fault, but the whole point of the stay was to be on the beach. Instead we went to a beach club/hotel in Tulum for a day to enjoy the beach and peace of quiet there. (Om beach club and cabanas....highly reccomend) Had we known, we would have gone elsewhere. The hotel does get bonus points for discounting our room without us asking. ($20 discount per night). Rooms: Meh. We stayed in a "partial ocean view"...we wanted an ocean room, but there are only 2, and none were available. When we arrived, the ocean view room on the top floor was open and we got a peek. It looked really nice...large fridge, huge TV, amazing view. We stayed in the room across the hall.....$30 less, but not comparable. A small, filthy TV (but with good english channel selection), a small balcony with VERY partial view of the ocean (ocean could only be seen from the balcony, and only for the one third of the balcony), otherwise the room looked onto the restaurant below. A.C. didn't work well, shower knobs were broken, screen in shower was broken and made an irritating loud noise till we stuffed tissue in between. Small fridge. Room was generally a little run down and wasn't worth the extra $$ for partial view, however after peeking at some of the garden rooms, I think ours was one of the nicer ones. If you MUST stay here, I wouldn't do it unless you can get the nice ocean front. The kicker was how loud the room was. I admit that after reading reviews I knew there was going to be some noise from the bar and live bands, but even with earplugs, it didn't come close to blocking the sound. No biggie as we were told there was live music until midnight which is a reasonable hour, but the bands played until 2 am on the weekend. Nuff said. Food: The food was average and overpriced for what you are getting.. We ate very well in Playa Del Carmen, and the food in most places is priced around the same as fusion but just better quality, and tastier. Out of 3 attempted meals, the burger was pretty good. If you want great food in Playa, head to Babe's (thai-ish restaurant) on 10th....AMAZING! All in all, this place really just didn't have anything that enamored us. A lot of staff, but no one is all that helpful or friendly, with a few exceptions. Just a generally "off" vibe. My suggestion is stay elsewhere, eat elsewhere, and come to Fusion for a few drinks and the entertainment. That way, you can at least go home and actually get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Location but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Traveler227
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, we were not expecting Fusion to be a luxury hotel. However, there were a few issues that should be mentioned. First, the good: The hotel is in a prime beach location in the heart of Playa. We easily walked everywhere. The nightly music was nice and it was very convenient to have umbrellas and food/drink service at our own beach hotel rather than having to go to a separate beach club. Also, our room A/C worked fine and was clean. The frint desk personnel were also very nice and helpful. Now, the bad: Our room (#21) faced the street and loud would be an understatement. There appears to be an after-hours club nearby and the partiers would catch cabs right next to our room starting at 5:00AM. It sounded as though 20 screaming people were in our oom with us from 5-8 AM. This was after the nightly music ended around midnight or so and the garbage and water trucks arrived at 4AM as a previous review noted. The lights from the hotel next door also caused it to be light enough to read a book in bed without any light all night. We did try to change rooms to an interior room but all were full during our stay. It should also be mentioed that there are no in-room safes or hairdryers and the front desk safe was only open from 8AM-8PM. We also felt that the food was good but very overpriced in comparison to other locations. The beach service was also slow and we usually had to walk up to the bar for quicker service. The Fusion could be really great but for the high-season cost, I think you could do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Morley_Tripper
Reviews.Content: Like a few people I wasnt staying here, was staying in the Riu yucatan in Playacar, we visited here two nights running for a meal based on the recomendation of our thomson rep. We dined on the beach both night and it was an amazing atmosphere, and the food was absolutely amazing, great sized portions and all fresh! Also tried a few of the cocktails while we were there which were the best! My partner is vegan and found things to eat very easily on the menu! Easily the best food, drink, and service we had in our stay! The staff were fantastic, so friendly and welcoming. Next time we visit playa del carmen we fully intend to try staying at the hotel as well as fully exploring the menu! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: sulpicia
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Fusion four days ago and will remain for another four. I’m sharing my thoughts because this venue (tripadvisor) is the reason I chose this hotel, and I will forget to post this if I don’t do it while I’m here. I admit I have the best room in the place – in my opinion. I needed a treat and this room (19) is an absolute treat. I hate air conditioning, so can’t say if it works. The fridge works. The microwave works. The lights work. There’s a big flat screen TV but I don’t watch TV so I don’t know if it works. The staff, all but one, are super-nice. I speak French and English but for some reason, my tongue twists around Spanish. Yet everyone has been patient with me and kind to me. Prices are ridiculously less than prices from where I come from… so I can’t speak to that . The food is tasty. (The breakfast bread basket is a touch dry but I dip the bread in my cappuccino. Problem solved.) The music (all live) ranges from sitar at breakfast to reggae, jazz, and various other genres throughout the evening. Don’t get this room if you plan on going to bed before 2 am. I have no issues because I have stayed up late to think and write. If you love music – this is the room for you. You can enjoy it from the balcony or on the beach or from the open-air restaurant. The massage therapist is excellent. Reception is excellent. The room is VERY clean and kept clean. The location is perfect. I am on the beach. I walk in the mornings and in the evenings. I have easy access to the famous 5th Street. To anyone who wants to come here: I suggest that you read through the various accolades and complaints and figure out what it is you really want. Playa del Carmen has all sorts of hotels. This one turned out to be perfect for me. Questions? You can email me [--]

Reviews.Title: “Laid-back bliss right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: WSISonoma_California
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel twice, last time in Spring this year. It's a great find. Affordable beachfront with music and good food. Fusion blends chilled laid-backness with warm and hospitable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience and food!”
Reviews.Author: bvita
Reviews.Content: I got back from a 4 day trip to Playa just yesterday, and I have to share how great Fusion restaurant is. We did not stay at the hotel - we stayed next door at Luna Encantada, but everyday for lunch, we walked over to Fusion. If your idea of a great lunch is excellent food, cold drinks, feed in the sand, chill music and the Caribbean beach, then this is the place. I travel to Playa every year, and some how this is the first time I've been to Fusion....from now on, we are making it a must while in Playa. No clubby music, great jazz/reggae bands at night, good service and the waves crashing.....I miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: showte
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 3 stars just because of the location and the friendly and very accomodating staff but other than that the rooms are more than depressing. With the price they charge they should at least put some paint on the walls and get rid of the bugs that swarm the rooms. I would not recommend staying at this hotel unless you just want to party and have somewhere to crash but even with that being said you typically wont want to stay in these rooms because it will be a downer to your whole Playa experience. * also rooms are not spacey at all,you feel very cramped and dont even have a phone or feel secure what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fusion in May 2009. I'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: clgalore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fusion over Memorial Day weekend for 4 nights. I went with my sister. Fusion was exactly like what other people have described. Rooms are very basic but clean – we had 2 double beds and were in the back (away from beach. More quiet at night). Mattresses are hard (I don’t mind that), pillows were very hard, linens were very clean but low end, there is a small TV and a frig. No dresser/bureau in our room (there were shelves for clothes). Maids cleaned room every day. We left them a note when we needed something and they were accommodating. We also tipped. We stayed on beach all day, every day. Service on beach was excellent – the waiters were back and forth with food/drink all day (yes, we tipped a fair amount, plus added a tip to final day’s bill, but these kids were great!). Food - best fajitas I have ever had, burgers were average, shrimp tempura was decent, and grilled chicken salads were great. Drinks were good – excellent margaritas. I don’t agree that drinks are overly expensive. Most mixed drinks (margaritas/daiquiris) were 70 pesos, which is 5.32 USD as of now. What’s not to like? We drank mixed drinks and beer all day (beer is cheaper, of course). Beach was decent with enough palapas for hotel guests. Cute beach bar/open air restaurant. Continental breakfast (free with room) was coffee, juice, toast, croissant. They did have a full breakfast menu. I had French toast one day (55 pesos) and it came with a nice assortment of fruit. Two bottles of water provided each day in room. Pretty little courtyard with lots of flowers between rooms. Excellent location – short walk from ADO bus station, 30 seconds off 5th, right on beach, etc. Live music at night (we only caught it once as we were usually out on 5th), plus a fire show each night (we saw it once. Fun). And can’t beat the price. I have never stayed in such a small, inexpensive place, and yes, I would stay there again. No question. There are other places with nicer rooms, for more money, of course. I prefer the beach location in order to sacrifice room amenities. Any questions – email me.

Reviews.Title: “The caribbean hotel you've been dreaming about...”
Reviews.Author: Mexican_Fanatic100
Reviews.Content: My daughter picked this hotel for me because I love to be on the beach and close to everything, but I also want to relax. Fusion is the perfect place to enjoy the beautiful beach, listen to live music, eat delicious food, and to end the evening with an amazing fire show every night!
