The staff is incredibly helpful and so welcoming. Having breakfast every morning while watching the fishermen bring in the catch of the day is also a real treat. I relaxed, I partied, and loved Playa del Carmen because of my experience at Fusion. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone, it really has something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: sprytelyte
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff amazing. They went out of there way to make our stay special which they did indeed. The day staff especially. Wilbur Manny behind the bar were the best. The location can't be beat. It is literally right in the middle of it all!! No other hotel had more going on at night than the Fusion. Great bands, great music, even fire dancer show at night. The food at the hotel was great! I had chilaquiles for breakfast one morning, the bf had chicken quesadillas, we even tried the hummus. Many of the main courses (chilaquiles nachos with cheese even) are huge portions. The bf and I both have big appetites and couldnt never finish a meal. Splitting a meal is the way to go. All were YUMMY! Drinks were a little pricey, not too bad, but for what you are paying for the room you can afford to splurge a bit! The rooms are very basic, but who cares?? Youre not there to be in your room AND if you want to a vacation where you'll be in your room go to an all-inclusive. How people could complain about this place is beyond me! All in all I give this place 5 stars for ambience and location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian oasis that is great for the entire family”
Reviews.Author: chellealberta
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Playa with my three young boys. Being that it was only myself to supervise all of them, I was a little leary. The hotel is small enough that they could not get lost and secure enough that I did not need to worry about them falling into harms way if they were away from me. I did not want to stay in a big all inclusive hotel that you never left the property of. I wanted the boys to experience Mexico. The location is great just off of 5th Ave. and right on the beach. Everything we needed was within an easy walk. Kim at the front desk was a wealth of information and so, so helpful. I will definately stay at the Fusion again and recommend it for families travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Known for the location, not for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: mccaulg
Reviews.Content: But I knew that going in. Really. But with a sliver of hope, I wanted to be surprised. I had the ocean view, great music, great breeze, great view. The shower needs updating. It actually has a very slow drain, so i never felt like my feet were fully clean...hehehehe...oh well, I was only walking around barefoot again anyway. The hotel staff is all smiles. Bartender acted a little funny with my change...it was weird and awkward, and i have a feeling he knew it would be weird. Drinks are high (Playa high). Glass of wine, 1 mojito, 1 shot of tequila was a total of 240 pesos. That's about $17. But i was able to drink it right on the beach. Fire show and band was great, that's what really makes this hotel stand out. IF it weren't for them, I think I would have regretted staying here. Oh - having breakfast BY the beach was worth it too. Although I was told they wouldn't serve the free continental breakfast on the beach, only in the restaurant...you can still see the beach and ocean from where we sat. The breakfast is simple, very simple. The cleanliness of the hotel was good, but again - the rooms are simple. Oh-and the first time we heard another room's door close shut, we thought a bomb went off in the hotel, seriously. It was super loud. We got used to it though, and noticed that our door shut a little loud too. No iron or iron board, something you'll have to ask front desk for, and hope that others haven't already asked. The garden view rooms look nice from the outside. If you aren't big on being in an upscale, pampered hotel - but rather be in a fun, do it yourself, nicely located hotel with a great band...then this would be for you. I myself would not stay here again, but would def make it back for a night out.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location.”
Reviews.Author: juliajane79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fusion Hotel for four nights and absolutely loved my stay. The location can not be beat. Every morning I would roll out of bed and go directly to the beach. The beach, bar, and restaurant atmosphere/vibe is awesome, so laid back with a great mix of people. They have entertainment through out the day, including an excellent Reggae Band every day in the late afternoon. The rooms are very basic, but clean. We had reserved a garden view room, but ended up getting a partial ocean view. The only complaint about this is that it was a little loud at night, but that was solved by closing the windows and turning on the air conditioner. Some late night drinks also help to solve that problem. :) I found the service to be a lot better during the day. In the early evening they had shift changes with a new crew. Maybe it's because they get a little busier, but the servers are not as prompt and attentative at night. You just can't let it bother you though; how can you when sitting on the beach listening to great music? Over all the Fusion was a wonderful establishment, I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It~if you want to spend your vacation on the beach this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: Kikiskiski
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Fusion and loved it! The rooms are nothing fancy, actually very bare but how much time do you stay in your room? Woke up every morning to the sound of the ocean, had a complimentary breakfast (toast, coffee and juice) from the deck looking out on the ocean or beach side. Spent the day lounging food and cocktails served right on the beach. The service isnt always the best but the food is great. Live band everyday at 3 and again at 9. Also have a live fire show most nights on the beach. If you are looking for alot of "extra's" this isnt the place to go..no pool, fitness center etc. But if you want a casual place to unwind and love the beach this is it!

Reviews.Title: “difficult to give a rating”
Reviews.Author: cozy1
Reviews.Content: The last time I reviewed the Fusion i described it as Funky, fun, and full of atmosphere. During my last visit , though, I realized that I was describing the setting of the hotel and restaurant . The review might have been misleading to the readers. I neglected to relay my feelings about being a guest in the hotel. If I were the owner, of Fusion,I would strive to have my guests describe my rooms as fun- or funky- ot full of atmosphere. I would not want to offer rooms that were described on this site as a step above a hostel- or very ,very basic. The rooms just don't match the restaurant. we're not talking fancy here,..we don't want or need fancy. Just a coat of inexpensive paint in a vibrant color might bring a different feel. If I were the owner, I would also want my hotel guests to feel welcomed and informed. If there are any surprises to be had , they would be good surprises. We have all read on this site that the guests are required to leave their beach chairs at around 3:00. If the guests want to sit on a chair, they have to move to the restaurant chairs. Even though I was aware of this fact on both visits(only because of tripadvisor), I was still shocked and felt somwhat embarrased. The employees are instructed to inform guests of this policy as they literally take the chairs away.When I got up for a moment to, grab a hat that blew away, my items were moved from my chair and the chair was swept away. When I told the employee that I was still using the chair, he said "no". Most of the guests stood in shock. It would seem to me that a simple note to guests would offer more respect. Something like "Our beautiful beach turns into a wonderful lounge at 3:00. Guests will be asked to move to restaurant chairs at that time" could be posted in the hotel lobby. Seems easy to me. A full blown offer of respect would include the same posting on the website so guests would be aware before choosing the hotel..( If you check in at 3:00--there will be no lounging on the beach.) Upon check in I read that 10% would be added to my bill if I charged food items to my room. When I asked if that would be considerd the tip, I was told that they don't really charge the 10%. I wondered why they didn't take that statement off the form. When I asked if I would be charged extra if I payed with a credit card, I was told yes -(but I had to ask ). When I checked in, I was told that my arranged transportation (by the hotel) company was going to charge me more than the agreed upon amount. If I wanted to dispute it I had to wait to speak to the Fusion employee who arranged my transportation for me. When I spoke to that person the next day, she definately agreed that our original rate was correct, but I wondered why I needed to be the one to speak to her. We had tons of emails with the agreed upon amount. All of that said, I believe we will try the hotel again. I know that we will vist the restaurant. I would have been happy to write all of these thoughts on a suggestion form supplied by the hotel instead of on tripadvisor. But, there was no request for guest input. My whole family loved the setting of the hotel/restaurant and enjoyed meeting the employees who worked so hard there. Kim was great with emails and arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lukyn
Reviews.Content: Me, my girl and our friend from Boston were in Fusion hotel for a week in February 09. We liked the place very much. Rooms are basic, but the location on the beach is great. Beach bar and its services were very pleasant. The food in the restaurant was also good. Everything was close (shops, water sports, diving centre :-)). The staff was helpfull and nice (specially the girl from Holland). The music band every day was very nice :-). We have enjoyed it. !!!! Do not leave your money in the room. Somebody who had keys of the room stolen all the money from my friendś valet including old (not valid) Czechoslovakian notes).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome beach-front boutique hotel! Great nightlife!!”
Reviews.Author: jmfel1
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Extended our stay here for an extra 3 nights to stay for a total of 5 nights! Great friendly staff, very chilled out relaxed environment. Perfect for young travelers wanting to meet people but wanting something a bit more up-market from a hostel! Awesome beach-front location. We stayed in a double duplex room with a garden view (its cheaper than the beach view rooms and I think it is better because you're right up the back and don't get any of the noise from the beach bar at night if you want to sleep), two stories, accommodated 6 of us comfortably. Fairly basic but good continental breakfast included. Great value for money! Will stay there again if I ever go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but too many changes...”
Reviews.Author: Crissy-dee
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time I stayed at the Fusion, and it had been 2 years since the last stay. They've made some changes - some good, most not-so-good. The rooms have NOT changed...same old, same old. Yet their fees HAVE changed - increased cost for no changes to the rooms. The renovations done are quite nice, but that means that the Fusion is no longer a "mom-and-pop" type of hotel, as now it services the general public with their restaurant. Breakfast used to consist of unlimited pastries - and a wide variety of pastries. Now it was cold toast (or was it dried bread?) and one croissant per person. The fresh OJ was still fabulous - but the coffee was bitter, and the tea was stale. The food had also increased GREATLY in price - yet the quality did not match the new prices. Also: the area in front of the hotel used to be for hotel guests - yet we were told a couple of times that we couldn't sit there unless we "consumed" something from the bar or restaurant! Where else are hotel guests supposed to go to enjoy the beach?!? The Fusion advertised wi-fi internet access - but I was not able to connect during our stay there. I was quite disappointed, to say the least. The only redeeming factor was the location - and that is something they cannot change!

Reviews.Title: “A funky oasis”
Reviews.Author: RoadKing0550
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a week at Playa... we stayed on the beach a few doors down but had 3 meals and many cocktails at Fusion. We enjoyed New Year's Eve there. The place has a fantastic personality and a great menu. There are tables on the beach or you can sit in the open air bar. We are fussy about the quality of food and were not disappointed. Everything arrived hot or cold as ordered and was delicious. The place is well staffed and service was excellent. Drink prices are a bit high but you're paying for the atmosphere and entertainment ! There is live music every afternoon and evening. There is a fire show every night right on the beach. We'll definitely be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Orangegirl31
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay from the start. We were checked in by Kim, who was very nice and even helped us with our parking situation. Our room was in the garden area, and while it was a little outdated, it was cozy and served it's purpose. This hotel is right on the beach, and it is a nice beach unlike in front of some of the pricier hotels. They have a free breakfast in the morning where you can eat and drink while looking out at the ocean. There was live entertainment in the restaurant the nights we were there, and the hotel is very close to 5th avenue with all the stores. This is a great hotel at a great price and we would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise simply Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Speechies
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just returned to the States after spending 5 days at the Fusion Hotel which is by far the best place to stay in Playa del Carmen. After being warmly welcomed by the amazing hotel staff, we were shown to our rooms which were nestled among a gorgeous tropical garden. The rooms were spacious, clean, and quiet escapes from the Caribbean sun. Fusion's staff left wonderful towel sculptures on the bed to welcome us back to our room after lounging on the beach, browsing shops on 5th Ave., or spending time at the delicious restaurant and bar. The waiters were very attentive and the bartenders made the best drinks to be found in Playa del Carmen. We spent our evenings sipping drinks at the bar gazing out across the mesmerizing Caribbean waters. All the activities of the day would melt away and refresh us for the night ahead. We danced the night away to a blend of Latin jazz and Reggae music performed by a live band each evening. We even caught a Fire Dancer performance right in front of the hotel. Fusion is the only place you need to know about in Playa del Carmen. We hope to return for many future vacations. Fusion is Paradise, simply, Paradise

Reviews.Title: “relax is the name of the gmae”
Reviews.Author: asafos
Reviews.Content: i will not say too many words because i dont have the power for it, but i will say the right words, and thats what is importent. i arrived with my friends to fusion after a Recommendation of another israeli guy who said to us that this is the place and there is no use wondering in strangers fields. the hotel is Beautiful, lots of plants, very clean, very warm, the rooms were great, simple, clean but with everything you need. all the staff is more than nice, this is not an act for the turist, there are really great people who work there, that is importent to them that you will have good time and relax, and if you have a question or a problem they are the one to help you. i will mention kim anna and rotem the owner who helped us with every thing we needed(directions, great recomandtions, cure for the gad dam cold that i had, anything) one inch from the mar, great food at the resturant, live show every night, what else do we need??? nada maan. and if wasnet clear, i liked every second i been there everyone can build an hotel i guess, but to create such a good atmosphire you need more then money, you just got it or you dont, and in here we got it, alot of it

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: elaineblee
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Fusion on our way south. It was super easy to find from the Cancun Airport. And we were lucky enough to get off street parking right outside the hotel. There was actually a bit of confusion with our booking between emails and phone calls. But Kim was awesome and set us up with a room, and a discount. The location was perfect. RIght on the beach close to 5th, but far enough away to be quiet. The rooms were pretty basic, but you are really paying for the rest of the hotel. The room had great A/C and a comfortable bed. Hotel is on the beach with a really cool bar and great beach access. For its price range we think its a great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive bar”
Reviews.Author: cosborne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fusion in 2007 and loved it. We were told they were remodeling in 2008 (it never happened) so we stayed at the Alhambra in 2008 and loved it even more. We went to the Fusion one night for an after dinner drink. We ordered 2 coffee with Baileys and it was $16 for two drinks. We thought that was terribly expensive since dinner was $18 that night. The rooms at the Fusion are very basic and mostly run-down but clean and we were happy there but were looking forward to the remodel. The Alhambra was much nicer for not a whole lot more money and the cleanest motel I have ever stayed in - ANYWHERE. The high cost of the drinks really left a bad taste for us. We won't be back to the Fusion.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: cdewys
Reviews.Content: You get exactly what you bargained for here. The rooms are utterly immaculate and the cleaning staff is wonderful. The wait staff on the beach is also always on top of it…you will not really need to venture anywhere else on the beach. The chairs and umbrellas are plentiful. The food at the restaurant is actually quite good. The free continental breakfast is exactly what you’d expect w/ a free continental breakfast, i.e. toast (jam and butter), coffee, tea, juice. The proximity to the bus station is walkable and it is nice to be about 30 meters from the main avenida quinta. If you are not fussy about music you’ll love this small hotel. The bands play almost every night and you may hear them from your room. Honestly though, w/ the air on, I barely ever heard them. I’d go back. Oh, ...and the blond that works there is possibly one of the most captivating, stunning, beautiful women I have ever met in person.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Money”
Reviews.Author: marson1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (mid 40's) spent 10 days in Isla Mujeres and took an overnight adventure to Playa during our last couple days there. We took the city bus there, not knowing where we would stay... found Hotel Fusion to have a drink on the beach... everyone was so friendly... music was great (funky) we decided to stay in their 2nd floor ocean front room with king bed. It was very clean and provided everything we needed. All the staff there was very friendly, so we are booking our next trip to Playa Del Carmen for February 2009 and will be staying at Hotel Fusion for 11 days. Return customers is always the greatest compliment.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis between the big resorts”
Reviews.Author: mika80
Reviews.Content: I am writing this on our last day at Fusion. I am sitting in the lobby of the hotel where they have wireless internet and I have the beautiful ocean as my background. We spent a week in this place and absolutely loved it. The rooms are basic but clean, which we find very important. The room has an AC, TV and a fridge. Even though the rooms are basic, the rest of the hotel and bar make it an amazing place. The garden is beautiful and quiet, the people are friendly and the location couldn't be better. During the last week they had different kinds of live music on the beach in the evening. We just sat on the beach, sipping on a margarita, while listening to the music. A great atmosphere. We have room #7. If we would visit Playa del Carmen again we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Carmen As It Was”
Reviews.Author: JeffSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel captures the best of what made Playa a great place to visit. If you're looking for a true Playa experience, this is the place. The rooms are clean with a fridge, ceiling fan, and air conditioner. In room #20 I had no hot water and a gecko living in the bathroom. But, for me, this is Playa del Carmen. I have been visiting Playa since 1984 when the Blue Parrot was the only hotel on the beach. Since then, Playa has grown tremendously but Hotel Fusion still maintains the feeling of the old Playa that I remember from my earlier trips. Every morning when I rolled out of bed and stumbled down to my chair underneath a palapa, Carlos or Ricardo were ready to serve me my complimentary continental breakfast with big smiles. After my mid-morning nap, I took my place on the beach again and spent the afternoon being served giant margaritas and watching Rotis, the owner, fishing with a net to find a catch for the menu that night. Checking with Diana at the desk about where to buy a magazine or the best place to rent a car was always pleasant. She and the other front desk staff were always smiling and very helpful. In the evening the whole place changes to a beach front nightclub with some incredible live bands. Actually, some of the best music I heard while there. If you are looking for an all-inclusive resort where you hang out with other American tourists for your entire vacation, this place is not for you. However, if you enjoy a bit of adventure, like meeting people from around the world, and want the true Playa experience, make your reservation now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - OK room - Nasty service”
Reviews.Author: HMW3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night in Mexico, of our 10 day trip, choosing to revisit PDC for a day instead of downtown Cancun. The hotel is ideally situated on the beachfront and therefore convenient to Fifth Avenue. This is what you are paying for - location. Beach area is small and water is inaccesible (due to the rocks) but can be easily accessed by walking a down and around them via the property next door. We stayed in a lower level garden room which was very spacious. The garden area is quite nice and many plants were in bloom. The room had 2 queen size beds and a small refrigerator. The rooms are dated and show their age. The A/C was poor and didn't do a very good job. Luckily there was a ceiling fan which was invaluable.. The beds are poor as you are sleeping on the box springs - not a mattress. The wireless internet was not available in the room, we were able to get a signal the lobby/bar area, but still were unable to connect. Our check in went smoothly and the young woman was very pleasant and nice. Unfortunatley, that was our last nice interaction with any of the staff. From there treatment was rude and callous. You will not be allowed to get a beach chair after 3pm and don't expect to be able to sit anywhere in the upstairs bar area - except the small lobby area - without ordering drinks/food- even if the place is nearly empty!!! This treatment was very disappointing and unlike anything that we have experienced in any of our 4 trips to Mexico. Basically as a guest of the hotel only entitles you to use of the room and nothing else. You'd be better off staying elsewhere and come down for a drink or a bite to eat. Given our shabby treatment, we chose to drink and eat elsewhere so I can't comment on food and drink quality. I probably will not return to the Fusion and certainly can not recommend it due to the service.

Reviews.Title: “not room 6”
Reviews.Author: GoinPeace
Reviews.Content: We weren't there long Got in at 10 p.m. and to be fair were gone by 10 the next morning. A nice older man carried our bags up the couple flights of stairs to the room. Towels were arranges in bird sculpture. Fridge was unplugged, water in tray, airconditioner not on, quite noisy when on, room sweltering, ants in the room, wires hanging out of the ceiling connecting the fan to the wiring inside. Bed base is cement and there are these odd tiny cement bugs? on the bed and night table. Sheets very thin and bed lumpy. The "blanket" was two twin blankets for a queen size bed. We could see some of the downstairs rooms were nicer....I think we got the last room available although we booked a couple weeks ahead but for 129.00 including taxes, we paid too much. We could have got a nicer room somewhere for the same or a little more and not been afraid to leave our suitcase unzipped for fear of exporting the ants. The owners have tried to update it and there is evidence of repainting etc and work going on downstairs. Workmanship not adding class in some cases and skill or care is missing but it is covering what was there. Its location is awesome and potential huge and I hope they get it figured out. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast in the am and not the band at night either which may have improved our stay. The room we stayed in was worth 50.00 max. Its up a flight of stairs so not for bad legs I am glad others have enjoyed it but I would be really gun-shy of this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mattmacnamara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusion for 4 Nights in May 06. It was just my fiance and I, we had the Ocean View room on the 2nd Floor. This place is not one of your all inclusive types, it is very good for people who only use their hotels to sleep. For what we paid, it could not have been better. The young woman and the front desk was very helpful, and waiter and bartender at the restaurant were as well. Very good food and a bucket of SOL for $4. I highly recommend staying here and be sure and check out The Blue Lobster Restaurant, damn its good!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for price/value”
Reviews.Author: RemoT
Reviews.Content: I needed comfortable and clean hotel for a week in Playa del Carmen, as a base for day trips. The choice of the Fusion Hotel turned out to be great for me and my two children. It is a small, clean and friendly hotel, right on the beach. The rooms are basic and the price/value good. If you have a car, keep into account that the hotel is located right off the main busy street, and parking in the vicinity is difficult; I chose to park a few bloks away and walk to the hotel (perfectly fine). The vicinity to the main busy street was not a problem at all for noise, as the hotel is tucked away and quiet. In summary, I was very satisfied and I would chose it again if I had to go back to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “A great place right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: ldamason
Reviews.Content: We just returned from PDC and truly enjoyed our stay at the Fusion. We had booked one of the larger rooms that could accomodiate two couples, with a downstairs and upstairs. The night before we were to leave our friend discovered his passport had expired and they would need to cancel. We had already decided to go on the trip (although of course they would be missed.) Why should their misfortune be our misfortune? Right? Anyway we showed up expecting to pay for the larger room that we now didn't need, but upon check-in we requested a smaller room and we were surprised that we were moved to the smaller room that we requested and without penalty. We found the staff very friendly and accomodating. The restrauant and bar was really nice and the location was perfect. The bar area at night was very pretty with the torches lit and live music.That part of the beach seemed to be less crowded also. We had a nice relaxing time at the Fusion and PDC. We will be back in early November with our friends that missed out the first time. Why should they get to go without us? Right?

Reviews.Title: “French, Funky Fun at Fusion”
Reviews.Author: HeidioftheRockies
Reviews.Content: This funky French establishment is a great deal right on the beach. My husband and I only spent one night at this colorful hotel in May 2007, but it was a very fun evening. We didn't have a reservation, but were able to just walk in and book a room. We were guided through a flower maze to our second story room. The rooms are basic, but clean (with air conditioning, t.v. and refrigerator). They do accept credit cards and when I got my statement I was charge $74 - we felt this was a very fair price. The bed wasn't very comfortable, but after a hot day in the sun I didn't lose any sleep over it. The hotel has an ideal location - right on the beach and only feet from 5th Ave. After spending some time people watching on 5th we came back to Fusion for drinks and dinner; music was also on the menu. A band playing covers of musicians such as Jimmy Buffet, the Rolling Stones and Bob Marley was first up and we were entertained by a little girl who felt the need to dance expressivvely to all their groovy tunes. A French couple was up next and they sang folky songs in French while we sipped mojitos and ate fish tacos. The drinks were pretty good, not terribly strong, and the fish tacos were just okay, but nothing was very expensive and the atmosphere was fun and laid back ($4.50 per drink). The service was very good. The clientele was mostly Italian or French on the night we were there; with the exception of one or two other American couples. We enjoyed the in-house dog, Libi. The next morning we had a big basket of assorted breads and orange juice (complimentary with your stay) while watching the sun rise over the Caribbean. We would most definitely stay at Fusion again. Extras: The hotel is within walking distance of the ferry. We stopped at several other hotels along the way to check out prices and rooms. There are some very nice hotels, but this was by far the best value for the beachfront location.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE Review!”
Reviews.Author: NJBart
Reviews.Content: Just returned from "The Fusion" and think most of the reviews missed the mark. The hotel is run down but has a prime location. The rooms are spartan, the a/c was loud and we had a few guests (ants). But overall, we were not disappointed! It was our first visit to Playa del Carmen, but we had visited Puerto Vallarta a dozen times. In Mexico, the people are wonderful and hard working. There is a different standard here - you have to roll with things! At $76 per night, you cannot expect perfection - we didn't and were not disappointed. Check in was slightly confusing and we were told the rate promised was incorrect - but the young woman was very polite and told us that the person in charge would be available in an hour and she was. No need to riled up - we were on vacation!Our garden room with king size bed was delivered as requested. We checked out the night before leaving to avoid any issues, even though our flight was at noon. We stayed in room 4, on the second floor in the garden area. I was amazed by how private and quiet the room was. The gardens are beautiful. The hot water and shower was adequate. The room needs an overhaul. The ceiling fan was hanging by a wire, outlets were loose, no drawers for our clothes. But again, $76 a night on the ocean. It was clean with a good shower! No toilet issues either! I was not overly impressed with the beach in Playa del Carmen. The hotel beach was no worse (or better) than any other beach in the area. I prefer the beach in Vallarta, but it is a much longer commute - a trade off. The water was calmer and warmer in PDC - that was a plus! The continental breakfast was meager but free! Coffee was excellent. The staff was polite. The first day, I ordered a marguerita on the beach and was disappointed. My second day (3rd, 4th & 5th), I ordered my marguerita at the end of the day at the bar. WOW! I was thrilled! Both bartenders knew how to mix a drink! My biggest complaint is the removal of the beach chairs in the afternoon. I come to the beach after 12 and want to stay until sundown everyday. At 3 pm they start to remove the lounges and bring in uncomfortable wooden chairs. By 4 pm, the staff demands that you switch chairs. Whether you are spending money or not! We ordered food and drinks the first day at 3:30 and forced to switch seats before 4 pm. The second day, my partner protested and was told it was policy. The third day and subsequent days we made a point go elsewhere (a few steps down the beach) at 4 pm and spent our money elsewhere in comfort. It really was stupid! There was always open space - bar patrons could have been told the lounges were for hotel guests only. They had no problem telling us to move! If we go back to PDC - we will probably go back to The Fusion. It's nothing to gush over - but a decent value in a prime location!

Reviews.Title: “Our nice stay at Fusion March 25 - April 8”
Reviews.Author: MilenaANDJarek
Reviews.Content: After excellent reviews we decided to go to Fusion. Days before our holiday reviews changed dramatically...why? We really can't understand it! Our stay was great! Rooms: Ok..our room was VERY basic, and we wouldn't be honest if we said it doesn't need renovation. We had ants in our room (even though it was 1st floor) and we sealed some holes we found with a toothpaste :) It helped to reduce them for about a half..and the other half left didn't bother as at all! Its Mexico and ants must be there! haha :):) And on the other side.. who spends beautiful Mexinan days in a hotel room?? We were there for 14 nights and the staff only started recognising our faces in the last 3 days, because first 11 days we were spending outside the hotel. Beach: Is absolutely great! not really wide, but you don't need to play volleyball there :) Not overcrowded and you can hear great music in the background.. There is a coral outcrop so you need to walk like 10 meters to get into the water (not 50 meters like I read in one of the reviews!!) The atmosphere, the privacy, the service are all for a big + . Garden: That's something magical about this little place! The gardener does a fantastic job and we are a bit jealous of his georgeous plants :) Staff: very friendly, very helpful. Waiters/waitresses are all young and friendly people. I liked talking to them, and never had any problems with any of them! Room service is also good! Beautiful towel arts! Libby: She's such a lovely darling! Beautiful and probably best fed dog in the whole Yucatan! As we are early birds we were walking on the beach just before the sunrise and she was the only one to join us! Always keen to play and swim. We loved her! Food: Oh yes! We couldn't omit the food! Everything was delicious, the portions are huge (as for us), and we often ended sharing 1 dish :) Our favourites: Fried calamari, Garlic mushrooms, Fruit plate (for breakfast), Fish soup, and all fish dishes were great! The chef does exvellent job!! Please tell him/her that from us!! And the prices are much better than on the 5th. Drinks: I am not a big fan of alcohol, so can't say too much about it. My hubby had only beer (Sol with lime), and I once tried mojitos, which was very tasty and refreshing! But what I really loved was orange juice (no ice :)) and fruit shakes. Overall rating for Fusion is excellent! Their weakest point are the rooms, but I heard that some of them are nicer than the one we had (which didn't bother us). The strongest points are: everything else + location. Regards Fusion! Milena & Jarek

Reviews.Title: “Con-fusion”
Reviews.Author: LindsJustin
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where to begin....LOL We got there and the reservation was wrong, so we had to stay in the duplex, I guess not a big deal cause we got it for free.The next morning we found out that they put us all in one, so that one room would be left open, just incase someone came by and wanted a room..I was NOT ok with that.Then one night we went down to the beach with our own drinks, and it was no big deal. we ordered something, after we were done them. So the next night we went to do the same thing, and got kicked off the beach where their chairs were....Keep in mind the money we are spending to stay there. We were not happy at all. They made us sit at the end of the beach. After that day, we wanted nothing to do with them. We slept there and that's all. We spent all our time over at the Mimi, which was great, we had wonderful time there and the service is perfect. We later find out that the bar staff and the hotel staff are run by different management teams...thats not good at all....So all in in.....Go to the MImi if you want a small hotel on the beach. They treat you great, they are beside bad boys, which has a great vibe, and if you want to enjoy the night life at the fusion you are about 1 minute away...I WILL NOT GO BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Newark, USA loves this excellent hotel. Pampered crybabies need not apply.”
Reviews.Author: Bohammer71
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by recent negative postings for this hotel. My recent stay at Fusion (3/28-4/4) was my second in nearly seven months and I cannot wait to return. The staff are all friendly and accomodating. For the price, an ocean front room is the best deal around. I prefer a simple, clean room with a spectacular view to a pampered, sterile enviroment in a crowded resort full of red-faced complainers. Set right on the beach, each day can be spent lounging on chairs with umbrellas as one of the MANY friendly faces working the bar/restaurant attend to to your needs with a smile. Great music is piped through the bar throughout the day. Fish tacos for $11? Fabulous! A bucket of beer for $10? Remarkable! Chilled shots of Don Julio Respesado? Get me a salt chaser with lime! The new owners have taken strides to create a fresh vibe with good food, excellent (and free) live music at night and a comfortable atmosphere that welcomes families, couples and singles of all ages. There's not a hint of the MTV spring break madness you'd expect just 40 miles north in Cancun. Playa has more of a Euro-South American feel that makes the simple act of gazing at the Çarribean with a beer and a shot the next best thing to heaven. Much of the staff are college kids from South America--a nice touch by the owners that's easy on the eyes. The girls on the desk are smart and easy on the eyes, too. A decent selection of Cuban cigars are available from a humodor on the bar! Granted, there are minor inconveniences such as the occasional clogged toilet and sparingly decorated rooms but what do you want? The owners address all problems immediately and as best they can considering Mexico is NOT Manhattan (I'm in Manhattan often and things can be just as bad). The scheduled renovation in June I'm told will help address these issues and transform the hotel into more of a semi-boutique oasis than it already is. I only hope the price doesn't skyrocket as affordablility is Fusion's strongest hand and a great compliment to its charm, simplicity and simpatico vibe. If you want five star don't come here. At three and a half hours from Newark, USA I'll go as often as possible. Complainers stay home. ---(Robert Frederick)

Reviews.Title: “What a great week!”
Reviews.Author: jms
Reviews.Content: I had read the "not so good' reviews the hotel had received recently and was a little worried. It turned out to be great... whatever problems they were having have obviously been resolved! We arrived early afternoon and our rooms were not ready... not a problem.... we just got a table at the restaurant and started in on the "buckets of Sol" and guacamole and chips. The woman who checked us in soon came to let us know one room was ready, but not the other... no problem... more Sol! She finally had to ask us to go look at the rooms. They were great... we had 5 and 6. Our other friends from Chicago arrived a little later and checked into ocean front room 19 which was really nice too... much bigger than the garden rooms. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning. The continental breakfast isn't enough, but there are so many good choices on the breakfast menu. I recommend the fruit plate. An entire plate full of delicious fruit for 60 pesos. We had lunch at the hotel most days, but went out for dinner every night as there are so many good restaurants to try in PDC. I recommend the hamburger for lunch! The restaurant/bar staff at this hotel is great! No complaints on any of them, but Carla and Oscar are the two that come to mind first.... what a sweet heart Carla is!!! There are bands playing every evening. There was quite a variety of music and I enjoyed most of them. Definitely something for everyone. One night there were over 100 people sitting out of the beach listening to the band. The only thing that went wrong was transportation. I sent 2 emails to Erika confirming our reservation. The reservation was confirmed but no response about the transportation in either email. I assumed (which is never a good idea) that they didn't provide transporation anymore and made other arrangements with playa.info. When we arrived there were two vans waiting for us. I had prepaid for the playa.info van so that is the one we used. I tried to explain the situation, but my spanish skills are pitiful and I don't think the other driver ever understood why we weren't riding with him :( I'm attaching a few pictures.... the date on the bottom is wrong. I thought I turned that feature off, but apparently didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: shandajr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Fusion started out a mess; our reservations were lost, so the ocean front room we reserved was not available, we reserved it 9 months prior to our stay, and the only reason we booked at this hotel was due to ocean front being available, we had travel partners at another hotel that we had planned to stay at to begin with. We were given a room at the top floor above the bar, which is very noisy at night, difficult to sleep. Also, the lights weren't working the first night of our stay and we had to find our room in the pitch black stairway. I was told that the lost reservation was the fault of the travel agents that we booked with, however, I booked 2 rooms at the same time and 1 of the reservations was not lost. All this said, we had a great time and made the best of a bad situation. The service/staff was very friendly, drinks were great and food was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, would do it again”
Reviews.Author: bswillmar
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel, right on beach, very convenient to everything. clean rooms, excellant staff. Oscar, Azael, Victor, Saskia, Gabby, Rotem, Alon, and Libby the dog. ALL great people. Food was great, service was great, prices reasonable, portions were perfect size to share. Cont'l breakfast that came with the room is toast, croissants,a pastry, and coffee - Adequate for my wife and I 5 out of 7 mornings.. We ordered breakfast from the menu two mornings. it was excellant, and enough for two people. while eating breakfast, Oscar would always have our beach chairs and towels set up for us. We always had lunch brought to us on the beach, again, great food and great service, and enough for two people. They would begin picking up the beach chairs about 330 -4pm and set out different tables and chairs on the beach. sometime around 5pm or so, a small band would set up and play a few sets of funky, jazzy music. shortly after another band would arrive and play for a while longer. The whole place is a totally relaxed atmosphere, all day long, and all evening. No complaints....Brad & Lori from Minnesota.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place (for some)”
Reviews.Author: Rand0la
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Fusion for 5 nights in March and it was fantastic. First off I'll say that if you are a 'resort person' you probably won't find what you are looking for here. If you are looking for a nice, little relaxed and easy going place right on the beach, this is certainly it. This was my fourth trip to Mexico and my girlfriend's first and we both loved it. We booked it online (partially based on the reviews on this site) which means you never really know what you're getting until you arrive, but I can say as soon as we got out of the van and walked into the courtyard we were happy with what we saw. The patio with tables and chairs, the bar, the breeze blowing through, the beach, the water, it was awesome. We stayed two nights in an ocean view room then moved to an ocean front room for the next three. I've been all over the caribbean and can honestly say it was the best room I've had: Nice sized and clean, big doorwall, ceiling fan, big balcony and RIGHT ON the beach and water. We slept with the doorwall open every night and soaked in the early morning sun in bed at 7:30 am. After walking the beach a few times, we didn't see a better room, location-wise. (there were a couple timeshares that had nice balconies) I had to wonder why the room was available, if I go back I'd book far enough in advance to get it again. We arrived at about 3, after checking in we sat down on the beach for a beer. That turned into a few hours and a meal. There was really no reason to budge. The food was great (chicken quesadillas especially) and they had a nice drink menu. Something not a lot of reviewers mentioned was the music. We're both huge music fans so this was a pleasant surprise. Every evening they had a band play a couple sets, then a change over and another band played a couple sets. It was all very good music, from groovy jazzy rock to traditional Mexican music. We stayed around our hotel a good portion of our stay mostly because it suited what we were after: chilling out. The walk to town was all of a block, it was great, we didn't get into a cab or bus or van for the whole trip except for airport transportation. TIP: If you wait to get transportation until you arrive, bring the address with you. Our driver didn't know where the hotel was and had to stop for directions twice. (We used Greenline for the trip from airport to Playa) The beach was clean, the staff was friendly and attentive. (this was probably amplified because we tipped before we knew gratuity was included, ah well) Right before we left home I read two or three bad reviews and got a little concerned, but after our stay I don't understand why someone would call it a 'dump'. Sure it's older and basic but in my opinion was quaint and interesting and so much better than being herded into mealtime with 800 other guests. That's our opinion anyway. I'd recommend it highly, just try to leave that ocean front room open for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: travelmomm
Reviews.Content: Well after seeing these reviews I felt I needed to speak up. My friend and I stayed there Fed 2-6. We had a blast there and would stay there again (as long as Kim is back, becuase that seems to be the problem) Rooms: You get what you pay for. I had no complaints. The room was clean, cool, working shower. Our Toilet didn't work one morning and by the time we got to tell someone it had all ready been fixed. Cute towel art too Restaurant: The food was good, nothing to complain about there. Yes it took the waitstaff a little longer as it would here in the US but we were on Mexico time anyway. Location: Great, right off of 5th, and on the beach, Beach: Right in front there were rocks, but I knew that when we booked. Not even 2 feet to either side was nice clear water. Instead of walking straight down to the ocean, you need to walk a little to the left, not a big deal to me. Staff: The waitstaff were all very nice, at least the ones that we came in contact with. I enjoyed this hotel. We didn;t go into it thinking it was a 5 or even 4 star hotel. You get what you pay for and if you spend $75-$80 a night, well thats what you're going to get. You can't beat that price and that location right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “A Sad End to a Once-Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MexicoMaven
Reviews.Content: I recently went down to Playa del Carmen with 3 other friends. We had reservations at the Fusion Hotel where we had stayed 4 or 5 times previously when it was under different ownership (and was called Hotel Alejari). The last time we stayed there was only two years ago. This time was a disaster. Not only did they have our reservation all wrong......(we should have been booked for 4 nights, but had been booked for the first night only), but the rude and arrogant young owners really didn't care at all that we were repeat guests or that the mistake was theirs. They gave us no consideration at all in their handling of the matter. We'd found out about the problem just days before our trip and had airplane reservations booked, etc. As this was the week of "Presidents Day" every hotel that fronted on the beach was booked, but fortunately we were able to find a lovely hotel a little further down and less than a half block from the actual beach for the remaining 3 days, so it worked out fine. The Fusion has lost its warmth and charm. We did not feel welcome there even for the one day we stayed and it seems that the new owners are turning it into a loud beach-bar type hotel with a staff that does not have the friendly, welcoming attitude they had before. The beds have always been hard and the rooms old and not fancy; the plumbing has never been up-to-date either, but we loved the quiet, laid-back feel and the staff who seemed anxious to please and glad we were there. These little touches that drew us back year after year are now gone and we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a dump”
Reviews.Author: WBD
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Fusion for Feb. 17-24 after reading glowing reviews on this website. Who wrote those??Because of the price, we didn’t expect much but nothing could have prepared us for the pitiful room we were given. Our room was “garden view” on the ground floor. Because we had to keep the drapes drawn, it felt very much like a basement room. The fan hung from the ceiling by wires, the shower dribbled water and there was mold growing on the walls. The beds were like rocks, covered by only one thin sheet. When we requested a room change, the arrogant cousin of the owner gave the helpful advice that “maybe the next day would be sunny and we wouldn’t have to spend much time in our room”!! The beach turned out to be equally aggravating. Although the rooms had refrigerators, we were told we couldn’t bring our own drinks onto the beach. At 3:30 sharp each afternoon, a crew came through to put away the lounge chairs and set up small tables and chairs to create a beach bar. If you should be so stupid to think that 3:30 was still afternoon and a time to still enjoy the beach, the crew hassled you by stacking the tables and chairs right next to you. We saw one woman’s lounge whisked away when she got up to take a swim. The “breakfast” consisted of a couple small croissants and toast that resembled Melba toast. After seven years of visiting , we are done with Playa. The Fusion and WalMart says it all.

Reviews.Title: “A real dump”
Reviews.Author: lizacat
Reviews.Content: This place had some high ratings and we were shocked at how bad it was. We have travelled often in Mexico and were aware of how comparitively spartan rooms can be, and this is a budget priced place ($80-$120) so we weren't expecting luxury. However, this was awful. Our room had black footprints on wall above the bed. The bathroom was missing tiles in the shower and the sink had no counter room around it, even for a toothbrush. There was no chair, simply and open shelf that wouldn't quite hold our two closed suitcases and a smaller 12"x12" shelf for everything else. The curtains were half hanging off the rods. We were overcharged by the waiters on more than one occasion and the girl tried to overcharge us on the previously agreed amount on checkout. The staff was rude and surly. On one day, the staff decided to remove all the beach chairs over an hour before the sun went down and just went around ordering people to leave without explanation. We'll never go back.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: golfizlyf
Reviews.Content: Fusion has a great location and vibe. Problems lie in the management. There is little personality in management and they didn't seem to care if we were there or not. Other issues were: by Mexico standards the worsed bed we have ever had in 10 trips to the area, no plankets for the hard and lumpy bed, 30 minute wait for coffee in the morning, sewer smelling water from the tap, no remote to adjust the a/c which was mounted on the wall too high to reach, disorganized check in/out. This little place has tons of potential, but it's not there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms flood but manager only cares about getting our money!”
Reviews.Author: PembrokeLover
Reviews.Content: Manager was not only not welcoming but a real aggresive jerk. I understand it's a cheap little place and could deal with the minimal help or communication when I checked in but... We awoke to find an inch of water covering the floor and our luggage and my wifes purse soakng wet. I told the manager about it and instead of saying sorry or showing any empathy he went on a rant about how the Mexican's are incapable of building decent structures and that the room we were in flooded routinely when there is heavy rains. If he had warned us the room might flood, I could have tried to find room on the minimal furnishings for my stuff. I told him I was checking out. The beds were wet and it was still raining. He became very aggresive and repeatedly threatened to call the police saying I had to pay for 2 nights stay. If he hadn't freaked out on me I would have discussed his early checkout policy versus the damage to my wifes leather purse and our soaking wet luggage. We found plenty of *much* nicer places for only a few dollars more a couple of blocks up the street on 10th.

Reviews.Title: “You have been warned”
Reviews.Author: kalifornia
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of all the great reviews. Unfortunately, our stay was significantly different from the other reviews. In all honesty, if our room was typical, I cannot see how this place is rated so high unless fake reviews are being posted to boost business. PROS: On the beach. Low price for being on the beach. CONS: Toilet broke our first evening. We had to use the lobby toilet for the rest of our stay. Room was very run-down. Yes, it will be renovated in May 2007. Breakfast was pathetic. Talked to other guests, and they had similar complaints. But these people had been here before, so they knew what to expect and they had a good enough sense of humor to laugh it all off. I'd recommend not going here until after the renovations are completed. I don't expect the hotel to spend money fixing something now, only to tear it out in May.

Reviews.Title: “Fusion...the Fun in the Sun Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rikbo
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 glorious days in Playa Del Carmen from Jan 20 - 28th of 2007. It was absolutely one of the best vacations my wife and I have ever taken. It really highlighted by our wonderful stay at the Fusion. There is not much more we can say that has not been already said about this wonderful gem of a hotel. Starting off with Kim and Alon who helped with great information and made our reservations effort very smooth. The staff from the waiters to Martina, our maid, were simply great. In real estate terms it is always location, location, location and the Fusion has about the best spot being smack dab in the middle of Playa as far as the walking street is concerned, 5th avenue. Most everything, including the Cozumel ferry, is a simple walk away. If you love to walk like we do, there are plenty of places to walk to. My wife and I and another couple had the two ocean front rooms with balcony and there is simply not a more beautiful view, in my opinion, anywhere on the beach. We walked the beach about a mile each way and did not find anything nicer. The rooms are somewhat spartan but clean and functional. We had the basics and that is all we needed. It took a little getting used to not throwing the toilet paper in the toilet (you have to use a little garbage can due to the old sewer system in Playa) but that was a minor nit. As other folks have noted the Fusion is scheduled for a renovation in the May time frame and hopefully things like the water pressure and some of the electrical will be upgraded. The beach, beach bar, and restaruant are great. The best drinks, in our opinion, are the Margaritas, Mojitos, and Cosmopolitans. Daquiris, Colodas are what they are, fruity drinks with not enough alcohol but you can fix that by adjouring to your room and spicing it up. At $4 a drink the price is very reasonable. Sitting on the beach at night, listening to a little new age or jazz music is just heaven...with the surf crashing in the background. This is not and hopefully will never be Cancun, it is just too nice here and in Playa the way it is. We left our sliding glass door open every night except one and fell asleep to the pounding surf...just wonderful!! We sampled quite a bit of the local restaurants as well and found almost all of them wonderful. I'll add somethings under the Trip Advisor areas for restaruants and things to do so be sure to check those areas out as well. We cannot wait to book again next year...same time and definitely the same channel..channel #1 in our book...the Fusion Hotel. You can keep the all inclusives...we'll be here every year from now on out!!!

Reviews.Title: “A truly great experience”
Reviews.Author: DKSeattle79
Reviews.Content: A small almost magical Caribbean atmosphere, good food, helpful staff and a great price point for the location both right on the beach and in the heart of the city (but still very quiet & relaxing). Kim, the manager, is a treasure and was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great bar and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: gingele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusion January 13 - 18th and really enjoyed our stay. We booked last minute and the hotel was very accomodating and communication was excellent. We checked in to room #2 which is a garaden room at the back of the property. The room was a good sized room with two queen beds, nice sized bathroom, minifridge, tv, a/c and ceiling fan. The only minor gripe I had about the room was that the lightbulbs they used in their fixtures were a horrid blue-white light, like a flourescent light. Only really an issue at night and we really weren't hanging around the room too much, so take that for what it's worth (not much). When weighing that minor gripe against the hotel's service, location and other charms the place definitely comes up as a winner. The beach bar and restaurant were the perfect place to start the day with breakfast (we always added to the continental that was included). A few days we elected to simply park it on the beach in front of the hotel and seervice on the beach was very good , too. Lunches were tasty and the cerveza was cold. I enjoyed the music they played, a world beat vibe versus the techno thump thump heard at many other beach clubs. One afternoon they had a live 4 person drum band and that was great. Having cocktails at the bar in the evening s was also a pleasure. Overall our stay at Fusion was a delight. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen's best kept secret (shh... don't tell!)”
Reviews.Author: katprat
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about the Fusion! We stayed there for 4 nights as a "pre-vacation" before renting a villa in Tulum for a week. After our stay at the Fusion, I already felt like I'd had an amazing vacation! They arranged our shuttle from the airport for us, which was there as promised and excellent service. On arriving there, a booking error (not their fault) had occured and someone was still in the room we were supposed to be in. Being such a small hotel and booked full, we were worried about what we'd do for accomodations that night--but they had it under control! We stayed in the "emergency room" the first night, which was small and simple but clean and a welcome place to sleep after a day of traveling. We were very impressed that the hotel had a back-up plan for situations such as this, and also at their desire to make up for the inconvenience, which they did by offering us a free meal at the restaurant. This led to nearly all our meals during the stay being eaten at the Fusion restaurant, because it is absolutely stellar! The food was amazing, everything fresh and flavorful, portions ample, and prices very reasonable. The drinks were great too, especially the mango margaritas. The servers were wonderful--our favorite was Juanita--she's awesome! They all took great care of us both at meals and at the bar or sitting on the beach, with big smiles and great recommendations, and impromptu Spanish lessons that made us all laugh. We also very much enjoyed the company of Libby, the resident dog who was beautiful and sweet and made us feel right at home when we were missing our own dogs! One word of caution though--watch out for the habanero salsa--OUCH! Our room was simple and clean, little balcony overlooking the street and with a partial view of the ocean (#20). Like others have said, it was sparse, but we didn't go on vacation to hang out in a hotel room. It had a comfortable bed and clean towels and hot water and a fridge for water and beer--what more could you ask for? If you're looking for luxury, this probably isn't the place for you, but if you want comfort, great service, amazing atmosphere, and a laid-back vacation, definitely try the Fusion--I will be back again FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: katwhl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Fusion. Haying said that, this is the first time I have been to Mexico, so I thought a lot of things were wonderful. More seasoned travelers may have a better take, or at least be a little more blase', than I. I thought it was an excellent value. We had a garden room (#7). The garden is small and absolutely beautiful, redolent of bougainvilleas, roses, butterfly plants, ginger, and other tropical vines & plants. When we opened our windows, the huge blooming flowers pressed against the screens. It was great. Because the garden rooms are in several small buildings around the courtyard garden, we had windows on two sides, which was great for catching the breeze. There was a hammock chair on the little poarch that we shared with the next room. It was my 10 year old son's favorite place to read. The room itself was big and very clean, but very spare, with white walls, white tile and just one small chair. It was all we needed. It had a tv, and we watched South Park in Spanish and learned some new words. We brought a clothes line with us from home, and the room had hooks for it. The air conditioning worked well. We never ran out of hot water when showering. We never heard our neighbors through the walls. The beds were comfortable. They consist of thick matteresses on top of a concrete slab that is built into the floor, which was kind of cool. You can't move them around, and i would't advice jumping on them The beach was great. We walked all the way from playacar to the last resort on the beach, and I liked our beach the best. The beaches by the big pier were better, but they were really crowded. The beach at Fusion wasn't, but I think that is because there is a private house next door. If that property turns over and they build a big resort there, the entire vibe could change. Also, the beach right in front of Fusion is great for looking at the waves and the sunrise, but half of it has coral which makes it bad for playing in the waves, So, once again, if the beach next door goes private...(Kim at the front desk said that Fusion was talking to the owner of that propery about acquiring it, which would great.) Oh yeah - The hotel had a couple free bogie boards, which my son loved. The onsite restaurant was very good and a good value. The drinks were good, and I got to try some Mexican beers. (Modela Negra(?) is really good) Even though Fusion is right in the middle of everything, the hotel itself was very quiet, which was great for us. At night there were candles on the little tables on the beach and people were quitely talking and drinking. The music mix was good, and changed during the day. Some places that I walked by were blasting dance music at 10am in the morning. That would have drove me nuts. The entire staff was excellent. Kim at the front desk was friendly and very helpful. I tried to learn Spanish before i came, but repeating phrases to a CD is completely different than talking to a real person, and I failed completely. But it was not a problem, everyone understood English. It is a 10 minute walk down the beach to the ferry to Cozumal, and there is a Yoga studio 5 minutes down the beach the other way. There is a market 3 minutes away, right on 6th & Quinta, that sells water, bug stuff, snacks & beer. (It also had the best prices on Mexican blankets, but the chips were 4 bucks a bag.) Quinta, which in the main tourist strip, is right up 6th. Having said all this, I don't know if this hotel is for everyone. It is not plush, or trendy. It is anti-fancy, i guess. I liked the clean, cool tile floors and white walls, but other people might like something more colorful, or with more furniture. Here are somethings that didn't bother me, but that might bother other people: You can't drink the water. I don't know if you can anywhere in Playa Del Carmen. There is a market 1block away that sells water by the gallon, so the first thing we did was buy a bunch and put it in the room fridge. You can't flush toliet paper down the toliet. That was true of everywhere we went in both Playa and Akumal (including a Burger King my son drug me to.) I knew about the toliet paper thing, so for our rooms, we brough gallon zip locks and put the used in there. It was not a problem. The light in the bathroom worked for about 5 minutes at a time, and then would go off. There was a window in the bathroom, so there was light during the day. There was a crack in the tile in the bathroom wall. The room is very spare, with just one batik on the wall. I don't know if the TV gets any English channels (We didn't try.) The hooks for the clothes line go over one of the beds, instead of being in the bathroom, which would have made more sense. I'm not sure what is going to happen to the house to it; before we make reservations to go back, I will email to see if there is construction going on next door; If Kim is still working there, I feel very comfortable that she would tell me the truth.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Spartan Room In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcfpny
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in a 2nd floor $70 Garden View room (#9) earlier this week. The Fusion is a very nice small property directly on what remains of the beach in Playa Del Carmen. The room was squeaky clean, if somewhat bare. Requested King bed was new, perfect, but low to the floor. Linen/towels new and great. Three window cross ventilation allowed me to turn off the noisy ceiling fan. The AC could make ice cubes, but either the controls didn't work or I couldn't figure them out. "On" switch was circuit breaker on wall -- tried it once, didn't need it anyway. Wall mounted cable TV worked well. No phone. No clock. Wake-up calls (door knocks) by the night watchman successful once out of two requests. Good in-room safe. Only in-room seating was a small upholstered stool. The balcony had a table, chair and hammock type swing chair. Adequate plumbing needs upgrade. No lighting by sink or shelf-vanity. Adequate small refrigerator. All that being said, the room grows on you. Although I was traveling alone, my somewhat harder-to-please wife (ouch!) would have (after some initial hesitation) enjoyed this room. The trade off is the room for the beachfront property, s one quiet block off the main drag. You can walk virtually anywhere you need to go. The staff, especially Kim at the front desk, were all great and couldn't have been more helpful. The included breakfast was coffee, juice and various breads - worked for me. Eggs and other stuff on the menu. Restaurant/bar layout, food and service was great.. If you're traveling here from the Cancun airport take the hourly (on the hour) $8 ADO bus, which will leave you two blocks from the hotel. I thought this would be an old school bus, but it's acually a luxury Mercedes tour bus that takes an hour from CUN to PDC. If you're a "carry-on" traveler it's a deal, if you're a lots of baggage type, it still works. I can't say much about excursions. I mostly went scuba diving with the Kim reccomended Phantom Divers and they were great too. I can't say anything about shopping - I'm a coffee mug and t-shirt kind of guy. Unless, you need the security of being able to dispute a credit card charge, bring US cash. All merchants prefer it and you get a marginal break in prices. A final note about leaving from CUN. Told to be there three hours prior to departure, I was (as a carry-on passenger) through the entire process in 20 minutes. I had to kill two hours at the bar! If I go back, I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “easily the best small hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: adrock85
Reviews.Content: so we didn't fancy being couped up in an all inclusive prison for a week or so and booked (for our second week on the yucatan coast) a room at fusion after reading the reports here. they weren't wrong. at the end of the week in playa we'd had a good chance to see the whole area and as far as the beach goes this small hotel was best by far. mainly for the bar/eating area, staff and quiet 'tulum style' beach vibe in the evening (accompanied by mellow reggae etc). so, the food and drinks - smallish range of food but all really well done. toasted sandwiches, burgers, fajitas etc. had dinner there one night and the fusion fish fillet is AMAZING. at 100 pesos really good value for eating on the beach in playa. the drinks are excellent. highly recommend the strawberry shakes and daiquiris! the frozen margheritas were excellent too. someone mentioned the mojitos were amazing and this happens to be my favourite cocktail so was keen to try it. not bad but not the best by any means that i tasted while out in mexico. needs fresh lime and sugar! bar etc - on the beach. nice view out to the sea with cozumel in the distance. watching the countless ferrys and cruise liners provided us with constant amusement through the day and evenings. in the daytime they put out sun loungers and have fixed palapa style roofed umbrellas to seek shade under. never got too busy although we seemed to be there in quiet season. not as nice as the beach we'd stayed on in tulum but hey, where is??? for playa it has a good stretch with a little bit of rock just at the waters edge but if you can be bothered to walk the 1 metre round it then it's no problem! all in all a good space. the staff - well! probably some of the best staff i've ever encountered. received a warm and helpful welcome and it kinda flowed from there. all very friendly and the girls that wait at the restaurant are exceptional. very friendly, very happy (always!) and very good at their jobs. made our stay all the more pleasant. thanks fusion crew! room - was very simple but clean and had a huge bed! tv and air con also plus fridge and ceiling fan. well decked out if a little dated. didn't bother us at all and made it quite cosy but those looking for luxury style apartments probably wouldn't like it. the maid was a real gem too and created some amazing towel sculptures! really made us smile after returning from a hrady day on the beach! hope the tip we left made her christmas a bit more special! evening vibe - playa is a very busy place and after coming from tulum we didn't initially like it. it has a main drag and laods of bars and restaurants. down on the beach in the evening at fusion though was just like being back in tulum. really quiet and lovely mellow vibe. ever helpful and friendly satff in attendance and some quality music being played. well appreciated respite from the madness of '5th avenue'!!!! fusion made our stay in playa all the more enjoyable and would just like to say a special thanks from adam and angie just in case anyone from there reads our review. if we ever come back to playa we'll definitely look you up again. thanks guys, adam.

Reviews.Title: “a real gem!!”
Reviews.Author: cubby2000
Reviews.Content: what a gem!! we loved everything about our stay. the rooms were spotless, the staff helpful and charming , the food at the restaurant great. and the beach in front well that just speaks for itself............ one of the few hotels in the area that still have their atmosphere. also the gardens are beautiful............ recommended highly.............
